TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய கர்மாதிபதியுடன் கூடி சுக ஸ்தானமேறிய ஜன்ம விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப்பட்டால் பிதுர் ஏகன், ஜாதகன் அவயவங்கள் ஊனப்பட்டவனாயிருப்பன். தந்தை இளமையில் மரணமடைவனென்பர். Translation This verse presents a karmic configuration where the Sun (significator of ancestors) is placed in the Ascendant (Udaya Sthana), conjoined with the lords of the 3rd (siblings) and 10th (karma/profession) houses-Mars, and aspected by the 12th lord (loss)-Saturn placed in the 4th house (comfort). This verse reflects a solitary paternal lineage, physical deformity or deficiency in the native’s body, and early death of the father. Interpretive Summary: The combination of the 12th lord’s (Saturn)	aspect and the Sun’s placement in the Lagna suggests karmic burdens manifesting through both ancestral isolation and bodily affliction. Explanation: Readers may refer to the general guidelines provided in the introduction for determining the number of siblings and their status. In this verse, Mars, the 3rd lord from the Sun as well as karaka for siblings, is with the Sun, who himself is also a karaka for siblings, reckoned from the 9th house. However, the verse states that the father is alone. Reasons are: • Mars might be combust. Though both the sibling lords are conjoined, there are no siblings to the father. The main reason is the mutual aspect between Mars and Saturn, which are enemies. • If we consider the aspect of Mars and Sun on Leo, which is also another house of sibling from the 9th house, it must give siblings. Still, due to the combustion of Mars and the placement of both planets in the enemy house, it has failed to provide siblings. Traditional Astrology Analysis 1st House (Sun + 3rd & 10th Lords) • Sun as Pitrukaraka in Lagna = paternal karma shapes the native’s identity. • 3rd lord (Mars) brings karmic patterns of courage, sibling duty. • 10th lord (Saturn) implies inherited responsibilities or family karma. • Strong karmic identity load leading to bodily afflictions and ego-karma linkage. Aspect of 12th Lord (Jupiter) from 4th House • Jupiter (as Pisces 12th lord) from 4th shows loss of domestic comfort, spiritual loneliness. • Aspect to Lagna = karmic sacrifice of emotional security, body, and paternal support. Nadi Principle Insight • “பிதுர் ஏகன்” (Father stands alone) shows the soul’s incarnation without inherited protection. • Sun in Lagna is not empowering here—it exposes the soul to karmic burdens from father’s unfulfilled duties. • 12th lord’s aspect = a severing of earthly support structures—especially in father’s domain. • The deformity noted is symbolic of karmic "branding"—a bodily expression of unfinished pitru karma. • Given the Aquarius Lagna and the likely Nakshatras: • Shatabhisha (if the planets occupy or aspect it) can cause bodily effects related to the immune, blood, and lower limbs (legs, feet). • Krittika or Rohini (if planets influence these Nakshatras) may cause deformities or injuries to the face, head, or neck. • The term "இளமையில்" (in youth or young age) generally suggests early death. Traditional Nadi astrology classifies early death as within the age bracket of 30 to 40 years. • Specific references in Nadi texts often mention death around 35-37 years when the phrase "young age" is used. • Relevant reference in Nadi: • From the general principles in Nadi astrology, early death of a parent is often associated with planetary configurations involving the Sun, Moon, or the 9th house, especially when they are afflicted or aspecting certain Nakshatras. • In this case, the positions of planets in Aquarius and Taurus with Saturn aspecting Sun and Mars suggest malefic influences on the 9th house (father's significator) and indications of early death. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 1st house activates age 1, 13, 25, etc. • The 3rd house lord (Mars) activates age 3, while the 10th lord (Mars) activates age 10. • The 12th lord’s aspect to Lagna adds emphasis at age 12—potential separation year. Nadi Age Progression • In Nadi, Lagna represents the early ages 0–5. • Sun’s placement here amplifies the karmic weight before age 5. • Saturn’s (12th lord) influence on 4th → 1st = emotional/physical events peak around ages 3–4. Notes • Health issues or deformity likely represent a karmic signature, not a purely physical ailment. • Father’s early death (pre-age 5) is a destined karmic gap to reinitiate lineage dharma through the native. • The soul bears its karma without shared burden—solitary rectification path. • Cross-referencing this pattern in BNN shows repetition in charts with Sun in Lagna + 12th aspect from 4th or 8th. • This pattern mimics a karmic detachment formula that repeats across several charts: • Sun in Ascendant + influence from a loss-bringing or moksha-signifying house (12th) • The aspect (or energetic influence) comes from the 4th or 8th house — both deeply tied to family roots and life/death axis. Why It Matters: • This combination often produces natives with: • Father-related karmic severance (early death, abandonment, spiritual disconnection) • Physical vulnerability or bodily mark/deformity • A karmic storyline centred around the redemption of family duties through personal suffering
உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி லாப ஸ்தானமேறிய ஜென்ம விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப்பட்டால் பிதுர் ஏகன், பத்து வயதில் மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This verse presents a configuration where the Sun (significator of ancestors) is in the Ascendant, conjoined with the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury and aspected by the 12th lord (loss), Saturn placed in the 11th house (gains). This verse reflects a solitary paternal lineage and an early paternal death around the age of ten. Interpretive Summary: The combination of the 8th lord (Mercury) conjunction and the 12th lord’s (Saturn) aspect suggests karmic vulnerability, while the 11th house placement introduces a paradox of gain intertwined with loss. Explanations: Father is alone: As compared to the previous verse, here Mercury conjoins the Sun. Mercury is the 8th lord, and it has no say in the siblings—Saturn, the 12th lord and enemy of the Sun, restricts the siblings. Traditional Astrology Analysis 1st House: Sun + 5th & 8th Lords • Sun, significator of father and soul, placed in Lagna, intensifies the karmic inheritance via the body and identity. • 5th Lord (Mercury) represents Purva Punya (past-life merits), intelligence, and children. Its conjunction with the Sun suggests inherited karmic residues. • 8th Lord (Mercury) governs longevity, secrecy, and transformation. Its conjunction here directly compromises stability and suggests life-disrupting karma. • Together, this trio indicates a soul born with intense karmic residue requiring early-life transformation. Aspect of 12th Lord (Saturn) from 11th House • Saturn, as the 12th lord, signifies loss, moksha, and detachment. • From the 11th house, which represents gains and associations, Saturn aspects the Lagna, activating a paradox: gain intertwined with karmic loss. • The aspect of the 12th lord on Sun in Lagna is a strong indicator of early loss of father and dissolution of the paternal link before foundational identity forms. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun in Lagna = direct karmic lineage encoding. • Conjunction with the 8th lord signifies pre-determined transformation, in this case, early father loss. • The 5th lord conjunction suggests ancestral karmic transfer, especially from the previous life karmic account (Purva Punya → Pitrukarma link). • Saturn’s aspect from 11H (desire/friendships) as 12th lord = karma disrupts gains through unseen losses. • "பிதுர் ஏகன்" again denotes no paternal support in this life—karmic reset through loss. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 1st → activates age 1, 13 • 5th lord Mercury → activates age 5, 17 • 8th lord Mercury → maraka implication around age 8 • 12th lord Saturn → age 12 as potential closure window ➤ All activations cluster between ages 5–11, especially age 8–10 (critical window for father’s karma to release) Nadi Age Progression • Sun in Lagna = karma initiates early; • 8th lord conjunction signifies Nadi severance of paternal line before age 10. • Saturn’s aspect from 11th = loss through association or unexpected events → peak impact age 10–11. • Saturn is in Sagittarius. As per Nadi progression, Saturn would have moved by four houses and will be in Pisces (taking two and a half years per house). Pisces is the 2nd house of maraka for the father, represented by the Sun. Notes • Native's life begins with intense karmic closure—paternal link dissolves before adolescence. • Emotional burden may be high due to Mercury’s position as the 8th lord—nurturing void. • Loss disguised as gain: The father’s removal opens the path for inner dharmic refinement.

TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் பகையடைந்து லாபஸ்தானத்தில் ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திர லாபாதிபதியுடன் பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் பிதா தேசம் சுற்றி ஜீவிப்பன், பதினைந்திற்குள் மரணமென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) alone in the Ascendant, afflicted. At the same time, the 11th house (gains) contains its lord, Jupiter, along with the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury. This verse reflects a karmic pattern where the father leads a wandering life, possibly due to displacement or livelihood needs, and dies before the native reaches age fifteen. Interpretive Summary: The affliction to the Sun and the presence of the 8th lord suggest instability and shortened paternal longevity despite gainful planetary placements. Explanations: **தேசம் சுற்றி ஜீவிப்பன்” – Indicators of Travel-Based Livelihood** General rules: - 12th house activation via lordship or BCP rotation - Moon in dual signs or conjoined with Rahu - Mercury/Jupiter influencing the 10th or 12th house - 10th lord in movable/dual signs - Tatwa–Antartatwa intervals triggering 3rd/9th/12th houses None of the above is applicable in this case. Here are the possible explanations: - Sun in Lagna emphasises father’s karmic centrality - Mercury + Jupiter in Sagittarius (11th) indicates income via movement, teaching, or advisory roles - Sagittarius sign supports long-distance travel themes - Saturn as Lagna lord subtly links 1st and 12th houses. Traditional Astrology Analysis 1st House – Sun Alone, Afflicted (Pitrukaraka) • Sun in Lagna, when unafflicted, grants dignity and alignment to the soul’s dharma. However, affliction here symbolises a karmic load related to fatherly matters. • "பகையடைந்து" (attacked or afflicted) = Sun under malefic aspect (e.g., Saturn, Rahu, Mars) → weakens vitality and paternal continuity. • A solitary Sun = Father’s presence is karmically isolated or cut off. 11th House – Gain with Karmic Weight • 11th house holds: o Its lord (Jupiter) in its sign = material promise and gainful potential. o 5th lord (Mercury) = Purva punya; inherited intelligence and dharma. o 8th lord (Mercury) = disruptor of continuity; governs longevity and death. • Despite strong house ownership, the presence of the 8th lord here dilutes the promise, linking gains with abrupt loss and transformation. Planetary Synthesis: • 11th house (Labha Sthana) = network, fulfilment of desires, paternal blessings. • Yet here, it's a paradox: the presence of the 8th lord alongside strong benefics creates unstable outcomes, especially for the father. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun alone in Lagna, afflicted = the soul is tagged with unfinished paternal karma. There’s no supportive planetary company, making the karma both personal and intense. • “பிதா தேசம் சுற்றி ஜீவிப்பன்” – Father wanders = not just physical, but karmic dispersion. The paternal energy is not grounded, not nourishing. • 8th lord in 11th = Ancestral karma is carried through material gains, and then broken through sudden dissolution (wanderer, exile, karmic exile). • Death before age 15 reflects a timeline where dharma has to sever early—the soul must grow without legacy support. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in Lagna = activates at age 1, 13 • 11th house = age 11 • 8th lord Mercury = activates near age 8, also key maraka year • Mercury (5th lord) = activates age 5, 17 • Jupiter is the 2nd lord of maraka from the Sun. Jupiter is the 3rd lord of longevity from the 9th house. Mercury is the 12th lord of exit from the 9th house. The conjunction of these two planets acts as a maraka for the father. At the age of 15, the 3rd house is activated as per BCP. The 3rd house, aspected by Jupiter, triggers the death of the father. ➤ The karmic concentration lies between ages 11–15, especially around age 13–15 when multiple house cycles converge. Nadi Age Progression • Lagna represents 0–5 years → Sun’s solitary placement shows a father detached from family karma from birth. • 11th house activation in Nadi cycles (Labha sthana) occurs around ages 10–13 • 8th lord’s presence here distorts fulfilment → unexpected end during growth phase. Notes • Despite Jupiter being strong, the presence of Mercury (8th lord) brings instability—especially when the father is karmically mobile or absent. • The 11th house often gives promise, but here it delivers fragmented gains due to the 8th house entanglement. • A missing or unstable father and the eventual abandonment of family karma before age 15 shape this native’s path. • BNN-style correlation: This pattern resembles charts with 8th lord + benefics in Labha Sthana, creating gainful interruption.

உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் ஒருவரும் பாராமல் பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் திருதிய கர்மாதிபதியான நிலமகனேறியிருந்தால், பிதுர் சகோதரம் பதிமூன்றில் நிலைப்பு ஆண் ஒன்று, பெண்ணொன்று, இருபதிற்குள் தந்தைக்குக் கர்மமுண்டென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) alone in the Ascendant, unafflicted by aspects. The 9th house (the house of ancestors) contains Mars, the lord of the 3rd house (siblings) and the 10th house, which is also ruled by Mars (karma/profession). This verse reflects a stable ancestral sibling structure—one male and one female (out of 13 siblings) — and indicates that the father will face karmic consequences before the native reaches the age of twenty. Interpretive Summary: The absence of aspects to the Sun suggests isolation or unmitigated karmic flow, while the 9th house placements emphasise lineage and duty. Explanation: Ancestral sibling structure—one male and one female (out of 13 siblings). While the total number of thirteen siblings might be due to the Karmic effects of the father, the living siblings can be identified by the presence of Mars and Sun. Mars is the 3rd lord from the Sun, and the Sun is the 11th lord from the 9th house. Mars aspects the 3rd house from the Sun, and Sun aspects the 11th house from the 9th house. Both the planets are male, and the houses they aspect are also male signs. One female might be due to the influence of the nakshatra lords of the concerned planets. Traditional Astrology Analysis • Sun in Lagna (Aquarius): o Sun is neither exalted nor debilitated; placed alone, no benefic or malefic aspects. o Suggests a direct karmic expression, unfiltered by other grahas. o Sun alone in Lagna often reflects egoic isolation or self-contained karma linked to the father. • Mars in 9th (Libra): o Mars is lord of 3rd and 10th houses (siblings and karma). o In the 9th house, it injects active karmic dynamics into ancestral matters. o Mars is neutral in Libra, but as a malefic in a trinal house, it can disturb dharma through aggressive karmic push. • Interpretation: o Lack of aspect to the Sun indicates no karmic relief or protection for the father. o Mars in 9H enforces karma through siblings or family role conflicts, suggesting pressure on the paternal line. o Sibling reduction (only two stable out of 13) indicates heavy ancestral pruning or lineage burdening. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun alone in Lagna: o Suggests the native is directly carrying ancestral karma, often without support or mitigation. o This is a classic signature in Nadi where the father is "alone in karmic burden". • Mars in 9H (lord of 3H/10H): o Indicates karma delivered via siblings or past-life professional failures. o May show the father working under harsh conditions, or facing consequences for professional misconduct in prior incarnations. • “Karma before 20”: o Often indicates Dasha periods involving 3rd, 9th, or 10th lords triggering the outcome. Age-Wise Activation (BCP & Nadi Logic) • Sun in Lagna: o Activates ages 1 and 13. • Mars in 9H: o Activates at ages 9 and 21. • Likely critical karmic window: Ages 13–20 o Could be under Mars–Sun, Sun–Mars, or Rahu–Mars Dasha o Dasha lords of 3H, 9H, or 10H (siblings, dharma, karma) may trigger father’s karma (e.g., death, loss, or exile). o Mars is also a maraka, being the 2nd lord from the 9th house and 7th lord from the 9th house. Mars is placed in the 9th house of the father. Mars and the Sun are linked according to Nadi directions, as both are located in the western direction. The 9th house becomes activated between the ages of 1 and 20. Since the maraka planet for the father is placed in the 9th house, the father dies before the native attains 20 years. Notes • Sibling contraction from 13 to 2 is not random — Mars’ aggressive dharmic enforcement “prunes” karmic baggage. • Native may experience a sense of isolation or detachment from the larger family due to this karmic pattern.

உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் தன லாபாதிபதியுடன் கூடி ரோகாதிபதியான சந்திரன் பிதுர் ஸ்தானமேறி யிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகன், இளமையில் மரணமென்பர் Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the Ascendant, conjoined with the 2nd lord (representing family/wealth) and the 11th lord (gains), Jupiter. The Moon (6th lord – representing disease) occupies the 9th house (the house of ancestors). This verse reflects a solitary paternal lineage and early paternal death. The Moon’s placement in the 9th as the disease lord suggests inherited karmic affliction. Interpretive Summary: In contrast, the Sun’s conjunction with wealth and gain lords in the Lagna may indicate material potential overshadowed by ancestral loss. Traditional Astrology Analysis 1st House – Sun + 2nd & 11th Lords • Sun in Lagna = the native is deeply identified with paternal karma. • The 2nd lord (Jupiter) governs family legacy and stored karma (wealth, speech, lineage); • 11th lord (Mars) represents gains, desires, and fulfilment. This combination suggests the native is born into a materially promising yet karmically burdened lineage. Despite the presence of benefic planetary lords, the Sun's placement with them leads to ego-bound karma, with a focus on the paternal role and legacy. 9th House – Moon as 6th Lord • Moon governs disease, debt, enemies (6th lord) and here occupies Bhagya Sthana (9th house). • This is a malefic influence on dharma and father—the placement indicates karmic disruption of blessings from paternal dharma. • 6th lord Moon in 9H = inherited disease, ancestral suffering, or service-linked karmas in the father’s life. Nadi Principle Insight • The Sun conjoined with family and gain lords indicates a karmic paradox: gain exists, but it cannot be enjoyed due to karmic dues. • “தந்தை ஏகன்” → Father is karmically isolated—perhaps estranged, or cut off spiritually from the family. • Moon (6th lord) in 9H indicates the ancestral line is afflicted, and father’s body or soul carries service/suffering karma. • This pattern inevitably severs paternal link early, often due to illness, abandonment, or sudden karmic closure. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 1st → activates at age 1, 13 • 2nd house lord = age 2, 14 • 11th house lord = age 11 • 6th house Moon in 9H = activates age 6, 9, and again at 15 ➤ Cluster of activations around age 6–13, particularly Moon’s role between 6–9, as the disease karma becomes active. Nadi Age Progression 9H represents paternal karma → activation occurs between ages 9–12. The 6th lord seated there turns blessing into burden. Father’s karma may manifest as illness or exile. Notes • A powerful material chart compromised by karmic reversal: what looks like strength hides decay in the paternal line. • Father may suffer from chronic disease, service-related obligations, or a karmic block to enjoyment. • Native likely receives early wealth/gain but not paternal guidance. Sun in 2nd house-Pisces இரண்டாமிடம்

இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் மோக்ஷகாரகனாகிய கேதுவுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டால், தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆணிரண்டு, பிதா ஆறாண்டில் மரணமென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 2nd house, conjoined with Ketu (moksha karaka), and the 9th house is aspected by the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury. This verse reflects a paternal lineage of two males and indicates that the father died at the age of six. Interpretive Summary: The conjunction with Ketu suggests spiritual detachment or karmic severance, while the aspect from the 5th and 8th lords on the 9th house of the father intensifies the death of the father when the native is 6 years old. Explanation: The verse states that there will be two male members in the father’s family. The 11th house from the 9th house is Leo. The 3rd house is Sagittarius. According to Nadi directions, all three houses are situated in the east. The sun is behind Mercury. The linkage between the houses and the planets Sun and Mercury gives two siblings. The Sun is a male planet, and Mercury is placed in a male house, which explains two males. The father dies when the native is 6 years old. The 6th house is activated as per BCP. The 5th house lord Moon is placed in the 9th house of the father and is aspected by the 7th lord Mercury, reckoned from the Sun. Mercury is also the 12th lord from the 9th house of the father, Traditional Astrology Analysis • Sun + Ketu in 2nd House (Pisces): o Sun represents the father, and when placed in the 2nd house (family, lineage), it links wealth and voice to paternal karma. o Ketu’s conjunction indicates a spiritual or karmic cut-off from family legacy and paternal support. o This can represent ancestral severance or absence of paternal stability in early life. • Mercury in Aries Aspecting 9H (Libra): o Mercury rules 5th and 8th houses: combining Purva punya (past-life karma) and life span/endings. o Its aspect (in Nadi terms) to the 9th house suggests karmic activation of ancestral debts and outcomes. o The aspect from Aries to Libra shows fast-moving karma — quick culmination of events. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun with Ketu: o Indicates fatherly influence is spiritually sealed or cut off. o May suggest father had moksha tendencies, or was removed from worldly ties early (e.g., via death). • Paternal Lineage – Two Males: o Based on Nadi directional logic: • 9th → 11th = Leo (Sun) • 3rd house = Sagittarius (Jupiter) • Sun + Mercury placements in Aries form directional triangles, suggesting two male descendants. o Sun = male planet o Mercury in the male sign = masculine karmic lineage. • Mercury aspects Moon in 9H o Mercury as 12th lord from the 9th house (loss for father). o Moon in 9H indicates nourishing karma but also emotional separation if aspected by Mercury (maraka from Sun). Age-Wise Activation (BCP & Nadi Timing) • 6th House activation (as per BCP) = Age 6 • Sun in 2H → activates age 2 and 14 • Mercury (8L + 5L) → activates ages 5 and 20 • This pattern shows: o Dasha or Bhukti involving Mercury or Moon can trigger paternal detachment around age 6 o Strong candidate: Mercury–Moon or Moon–Mercury periods Conclusion • Two male members in the father’s lineage are denoted through male planetary placements and directional links. • Sun–Ketu conjunction in 2H is a classical paternal cut-off signature in Nadi texts. • Father’s death at age six is supported by 6th house activation and involvement of Mercury as 8th lord. • Strong karmic themes of loss, sacrifice, and silent lineage karma dominate this verse. Notes • Ketu-Sun conjunction is one of the strongest indicators of fatherless upbringing in both Nadi and Parashari systems. • Although the 2nd house is usually auspicious, here it represents spiritual denial of nourishment. • Native likely grows with the absence of father’s guidance, wealth, and dharma. • Ketu in the family house = inheritance blocked by past-life disconnection.

இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஞானகாரகனாகிய ராகுவுடன் கூடி ஒன்பதாமிடம் பற்றிய பிரகஸ்பதியை ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திரம் பெற்ற ஜென்ம விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப்பட்டிருந்தால், தந்தை வர்க்கம் பூமி செல்வமுடையவர்கள். ஏழு வயதில் பிதா மரணமடைவனெபர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 2nd house, conjoined with Rahu (the significator of knowledge). Jupiter, placed in the 9th house, is aspected by the Lagna and 12th lord Saturn, placed in its own house, the 12th. Fathers' lineages will have lands and be wealthy. The father dies when the native is seven years old. Interpretive Summary: Rahu’s conjunction with the Sun suggests karmic complexity, while the aspect from the 12th lord introduces themes of separation despite ancestral prosperity. - Jupiter (2nd/11th lord) in 9th gives wealth via dharma, land, and father’s blessings - Placement in the enemy sign (Libra) may delay results unless Venus is supportive - Saturn (Lagna/12th lord) in its sign in the 12th confirms karmic expenditure and spiritual detachment - Saturn’s 10th aspect on Jupiter stabilises and confirms material gain - Indicates wealth through spiritual, foreign, or karmic channels. The father dies when the native is 7 years old. According to the BCP, the 7th house is activated. The 7th house is ruled by Leo, indicating the father of the native. The Sun is afflicted because of a conjunction with Rahu, who is the 12th lord of exit from the Sun. If we consider the progression of Jupiter at the age of 7, it will be in Aries, which is the 2nd house of maraka from the Sun and the 7th house of maraka from the 9th house of the father. If we consider the progression of Saturn, at the age of 7 for the native, Saturn might be in Pisces, where the Sun, spoiled by Rahu, is placed, indicating the end of the father. Traditional Astrology Analysis • Sun + Rahu in 2nd (Pisces): o Rahu’s presence causes an eclipse of the Sun, reflecting confusion in paternal identity or legacy. o In Pisces, Rahu may indicate a father engaged in foreign, mystical, or non-conventional activities, possibly distant or estranged. • Jupiter (2L/11L) in 9th (Libra): o Indicates ancestral blessings and wealth, especially from land or dharmic activities. o However, Jupiter is in an enemy sign (Libra) — reduced strength unless Venus is strong. • Saturn in 12H (Own sign, Capricorn): o Saturn rules both Lagna and 12th — here, spiritual sacrifice and karmic severance are emphasised. o Saturn aspects 9H and Jupiter via 10th aspect → stabilising Jupiter’s dharmic fruit but also imposes karmic responsibility. • Overall: o The native is born into a wealthy ancestral line, but the father’s fate is karmically sealed. o Rahu–Sun combo with 12L Saturn brings detachment despite prosperity. Nadi Principle Insight • Rahu–Sun in 2H: o Father’s presence is overshadowed by karmic imbalance. o Sun’s light is blocked, indicating lineage disruption, especially due to material desire or intellectual arrogance (Rahu in Pisces). • Saturn’s role: o Being the 12th lord, Saturn causes expenditure or loss. o Its aspect to 9H causes detachment from father, possibly a literal loss of father at an early age. • Jupiter in 9H: o Shows dharma from father is present, but overshadowed by karmic dues. o Despite wealth, spiritual or physical disconnection from the father is certain. Age-Wise Activation (BCP + Nadi Timing) • BCP: Age 7 → 7th house activated (Leo): o Leo ruled by Sun → activates paternal karaka o Sun is afflicted by Rahu → affliction matures at 7 • Jupiter’s progression at age 7: o Progresses to Aries → 2nd house (maraka from Sun), 7th from 9H (father) o Clearly shows maraka timing via Jupiter’s transit logic • Saturn's progression (approx.): o Could be in Pisces at age 7 → joins afflicted Sun = clear symbol of father’s end • Strong Dasha Triggers: o Rahu–Saturn, Saturn–Jupiter, or Jupiter–Rahu Conclusion – Verse 7 Aspect Outcome Father’s Lineage Land-rich, prosperous, grounded in dharmic merit. Spiritual Signature Karmic separation due to Rahu’s distortion of paternal light Age of Death 7 years — due to maraka triggers in 7H and Jupiter transits Life Theme Inherited dharma but blocked or lost before maturity

இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய கர்மாதிபதியுடன் கூடி ரோகாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆணிரண்டு, தந்தை பத்தொன்பதில் மரணமாவனென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 2nd house, conjoined with the lords of the 3rd (siblings) and 10th (karma/profession) houses, and aspected by Mars. The Moon, in Virgo, is aspected by the 6th lord (disease). This verse reflects a paternal lineage of two males and indicates that the father died at the age of nineteen. Interpretive Summary: The aspect from the 6th lord introduces karmic strain through health or service-related challenges, while the conjunction with sibling and karma lords suggests a lineage marked by duty and fraternal bonds. Traditional Astrology Analysis 2nd House – Sun + 3rd & 10th Lords • Sun in 2H emphasises the paternal influence over family values, wealth, and legacy. • 3rd lord (Mars) governs siblings, valour, and personal will. • 10th lord (Saturn) represents karma, profession, and public role. • This combination suggests a father who is active, duty-bound, with strong work karma, and possibly siblings who share in that lineage karma. • Conjunction in 2H implies the lineage is materially strong but karma-heavy, primarily through responsibility. Aspect from the 6th Lord (Moon) • Moon as 6th lord (disease, enmity, debt) casts a malefic drishti, indicating karmic affliction through health or conflict. • The aspect to 2H (family, continuation) from a malefic functional lord erodes the benefit of legacy and leads to suffering through the paternal line. • This affliction makes the father’s health vulnerable, despite his karmic engagement or stability. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun + Mars + Saturn = a karma-centric paternal line, strong in action, discipline, and responsibility. • But with Moon as 6th lord aspecting, the karmic package includes disease or adversarial karma—manifesting in the father’s fate. • “தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆணிரண்டு” = two male figures in paternal lineage – suggests a masculine-dominant karmic pattern that repeats and concludes with the native’s father. • I have already indicated in the introduction that for Aquarius lagna, Sun, in addition to its natural karakatwa of father, also indicate elder siblings because of its ownership of the 11th house from the 9th house of father. Hence, the conjunction of Sun and Mars, the natural karaka for siblings, indicates two male siblings. • Death at age 19 reflects a delayed karmic culmination, not immediate or premature like earlier verses. Suggests some paternal presence during upbringing, cut short just before full maturity. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 2H → activates at age 2, 14 • Mars (3rd lord) → age 3, 15 • Saturn (10th lord) → age 10, 19 • Moon (6th lord aspecting) → age 6, 18 • For the native, the 7th house is activated at the age of 19. The 7th house is ruled by the Sun, indicating the father of the native. The Sun is placed with the 2nd lord of maraka Mars from the Sun and is aspected by the 6th lord Moon placed in the 12th house of exit from the 9th house of father. ➤ Converging activation windows at ages 15, 18–19, marking father's karmic exit around 19. Nadi Age Progression • 2H activates during early teens, carrying family karma forward. • 6th lord aspect from Moon = karmic pressure builds through emotional or health-related loss. • The timeline suggests the father's karmic role fades by 17–19, most likely through illness or conflict-related withdrawal. Notes • This is a "karmic-burdened but not cursed" configuration: the father has responsibilities, not rejection. • His exit at age 19 signals karmic exhaustion, not abandonment or exile. • The native inherits both material and karmic gains, but must reconcile them with loss and duty.

இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் உச்ச நீசருடன் கூடி அஷ்டம ஸ்தானமேறிய திருதிய கர்மாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை பூமி மூலம் ஜீவனம், இருபதிற்குமேல் மரணமென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 2nd house, conjoined with both exalted and debilitated planets, Venus and Mercury and aspected by the 3rd and 10th lord, Mars from the 8th house (longevity). This verse reflects a karmic pattern in which the father earns his livelihood through land-related work and dies after the native has crossed the age of twenty. Interpretive Summary: The mixed conjunction of exaltation and debilitation suggests dual karmic influences—material grounding through exalted strength, yet vulnerability through afflicted energies. The aspect from the 8th house reinforces themes of delayed but inevitable ancestral separation. Traditional Astrology Analysis 2nd House – Sun + Exalted & Debilitated Planets • Sun in 2nd denotes lineage continuity, family wealth, and karmic sustenance. • Conjunction with both exalted and debilitated planets indicates a dual karmic nature: o The exalted planet (likely Venus or Jupiter) offers material strength or wealth. o The debilitated planet (possibly Saturn or Moon) introduces inner conflict, instability, or moral ambiguity. • This blend in the 2nd house suggests a father whose life straddles both privilege and burden, especially around wealth and speech. Aspect from 3rd & 10th Lords from 8th House • 3rd and 10th lord (Mars + Saturn) placed in 8th house → karmic intensity, secrecy, transformative action. • Their aspect to the 2nd house connects karma, action, and longevity to the family line. • This influence is heavy: it gives the father a karmic occupation tied to land (Mars) and duty (Saturn), but also creates the condition for eventual karmic termination beyond age 20. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun with opposing forces (exaltation + debility) = a father with karmic contradictions—gains through land/property but carrying inner imbalance. • Aspect from 3rd/10th lords in 8H = delayed karmic conclusion, unlike earlier verses. The father works long hours and then departs, transferring wealth/responsibility. • "பூமி மூலம் ஜீவனம்" → affirms karmic engagement through real estate, agriculture, or physical sustenance dharma. • - Sun (father) in 2nd house indicates sustenance through tangible assets • - Mars (10th lord) aspects Sun → profession linked to land/agriculture • - Mercury in the 2nd supports land-related transactions or planning • - Venus (4th/9th lord) in 2nd confirms property-based fortune • - Configuration affirms “தந்தை பூமி மூலம் ஜீவனம்” with karmic and dharmic depth • "இருபதிற்குமேல் மரணம்" → points to father’s delayed karma Phala, existing only after providing stability and legacy. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 2nd → activates at age 2, 14, 26 • Exalted planet activation → likely near age 16–18 • Debilitated planet → brings strain around age 19–21 • Mars + Saturn in 8th (3rd & 10th lords) → age 8, 10, 20, 28 • At the age of 20, the 8th house of the native is activated. 8th house lord Mercury is with the Sun, the father. The 8th house is the 12th house of exit for the father from the 9th house. Mars is the 2nd lord of maraka from the placement of the Sun and also from the 9th house of the father. Its placement in the 7th house from the Sun brings the end of the father. ➤ The father’s karmic arc stretches into age 20+, with culmination possible near 26–30. Nadi Age Progression • 2H activates from age 2–6, again in early twenties. • 8H Mars/Saturn influence → denotes long-standing karma, fructifying after 20 • Father’s departure post-20 aligns with delayed karmic realisation through property or duty cycles. Notes • This verse reflects a more stable karmic picture—the father contributes materially before death. • The presence of exalted and debilitated energies makes the legacy powerful but dualistic. • Death after age 20 is consistent with a father who fulfilled dharma and exited after karmic release.

இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் தன லாபாதிபதியுடன் கூடி, மூலத்திரிகோணமேறிய பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை பலவான், நியாயாதிபதி, சுகவான், அனேக பூமிகளை யுடையவனா யிருப்பனென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 2nd house, conjoined with the lords of the 2nd (wealth) and 11th (gains) houses, Jupiter, and aspected by the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury, placed in its Moolatrikona sign. This verse reflects a powerful paternal lineage marked by strength, justice, comfort, and extensive land ownership. Interpretive Summary: The trinal aspect from the 5th and 8th lords enhances karmic merit and longevity, while the conjunction with wealth and gain lords suggests material abundance and social stature. Traditional Astrology Analysis 2nd House – Sun + 2nd and 11th Lords • Sun in the 2nd house represents ancestral wealth and lineage legacy. • Joined by: o 2nd lord (Jupiter) → amplifies family wealth, strong values, speech, and inheritance. o 11th lord (Mars) → brings material gain, networking power, and accumulation of resources. • This is a powerful combination of lineage, fulfilment, and paternal authority. • The father’s karma is highly sattvic and dharmic, likely commanding respect and possessing assets. Aspect from the 5th and 8th Lords from its Moolatrikona Position • 5th lord (Mercury) symbolises Purva punya, children, and spiritual intelligence. • 8th lord (Mercury) governs longevity, occult karma, and secrets. • Their aspect to the 2nd brings a protective and dharmic influence. • Importantly, this configuration enhances the beneficial results of the 2nd house and secures the father’s prosperity. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun conjoined with Dhana and Labha lords = father's material karmic thread is robust—he accumulates, expands, and governs. • 5th and 8th lords aspecting from its Moola Trikona position = strong spiritual and transformational protection over wealth. • The father is described as: o பலவான் (strong) → karmically empowered o நியாயாதிபதி (just or fair-minded) → possibly holding social authority or judicial dharma o சுகவான் (comfortable) → has emotional and physical prosperity o அனேக பூமிகளை யுடையவன் (landed) → karmically tied to earth, estate, and productive dharma • No reference to early death: this verse marks a fulfilled paternal karma, often leading to positive inheritance for the native. • - Sun (7th lord) joined by Mercury (5th lord) and Jupiter (2nd & 11th lord) • - Indicates a father who is strong, prosperous • - Mercury lends judicial insight; Jupiter adds wealth and dharmic stature • - Configuration supports Nadi result: “தந்தை பலவான், நியாயாதிபதி, சுகவான், அனேக பூமிகளை யுடையவன்” Notes • This is the rarest of the verses—showcasing positive paternal karma, not loss or burden. • The native benefits from ancestral merit (5th) and stabilized transformative energy (8th). • Father likely lives long, owns land, and leaves behind a material and spiritual legacy. Sun in 3rd house-Aries மூன்றாமிடம்

மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் உச்சனாய் பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி உச்ச சனியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டால் கெர்ப்ப காலத்தில் பிதா மரணமாவனென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) exalted in the 3rd house, conjoined with the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury and aspected by an exalted Saturn. When the mother of the native is in the gestation period, the father will die. Interpretive Summary: This verse reveals a karmic culmination where exalted placements intensify the ancestral imprint. Despite the dignity of the Sun and Saturn, the conjunction with the 8th lord and the timing of Saturn’s aspect indicate that the father will die during the gestational period—suggesting a pre-birth karmic severance rooted in deep ancestral patterns. Traditional Astrology Analysis 3rd House – Exalted Sun + 5th & 8th Lords • The Sun in Aries (exalted) in the 3rd house signifies a powerful but isolated karmic placement—valour, siblings, and communication strongly influenced by paternal karma. • Conjunction with 5th lord (Mercury) = inherited Purva punya; this connects spiritual lineage and ancestral merit to the father's karmic pattern. • Conjunction with 8th lord (Mercury) = sudden endings, karmic severance; often connected with abrupt loss in familial context. • Exalted Sun + 8th lord = high-intensity karmic pressure; the father is karmically exalted yet destined to exit due to unresolved ancestral threads. Aspect of Exalted Saturn (10th Lord) • Saturn exalted (in Libra) casting aspect from 9th or 7th house onto Sun + Moon = strict karmic enforcement. • Saturn as 10th lord (karma) and exalted = father's karmic ledger is fully loaded and precise; death in gestation implies instant karmic clearance or detachment. • This aspect validates the early dissolution of paternal presence while preserving spiritual merit. Nadi Principle Insight • Exalted Sun usually denotes strength and clarity, but here it highlights a karmically powerful but destined-to-end lineage. • 8th lord Mercury signifies that the father’s prarabdha karma ends before the native’s birth. • “கெர்ப்ப காலத்தில் பிதா மரணமாவன்” — a profound karmic statement indicating the soul of the father departs as his karmic duty ends, even before transmission to the child. • Aspect of exalted Saturn = mature karmic enforcement, not malefic punishment—this is a timed karmic fulfilment. • The native is born with a symbolic Sun—a father whose influence remains spiritually but not physically. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 3rd house → activates age 3, 15 • 5th lord (Mercury) → age 5, 17 • 8th lord (Mercury) → age 8, 20 • Exalted Saturn (aspecting) → age 9, 21 ➤ Despite death in gestation, these years may reveal ancestral echoes or father’s indirect karmic effects. Nadi Age Progression • Since Sun resides in the 3rd house, the karmic signal for siblings and action begins from age 3–5. • Father’s energy may manifest symbolically through actions, dreams, or rituals during these years. • Exalted Saturn’s trinal aspect brings spiritual maturity early, often through the absence of paternal support. Notes • This is one of the most striking karmic setups—indicating pre-natal karmic loss of the father. • Despite the exalted Sun, the presence of Mercury (8th lord) and Saturn's aspect means spiritual legacy > physical fatherhood. • The native carries paternal merit without paternal memory.
மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாயிருந்து பிதுர் ஸ்தானமேறிய தன லாபாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால், பிதா இருபத்திரண்டு வரையில் தீர்க்கம், பிதா மன்னர் மூலம் மேன்மையடயனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) alone in the 3rd house, aspected by the lords of the 2nd (wealth) and 11th (gains) houses, Jupiter from the 9th house (the house of ancestors). This verse reflects a dignified paternal lineage, where the father lives up to the age of twenty-two and attains prominence through royal or authoritative associations. Interpretive Summary: The aspect of wealth and gain lords positioned in the ancestral house suggests karmic elevation and social recognition rooted in lineage merit. Traditional Astrology Analysis 3rd House – Sun Alone • Sun in the 3rd house alone (without conjunction) signifies a self-contained, action-oriented paternal karma. • The 3rd house governs siblings, courage, travel, communication, and effort, suggesting the father’s life path was built around initiative and movement. • The absence of planetary conjunctions around the Sun creates a clear, undisturbed karmic focus, with father’s energy being active but singular in influence. Aspect from 2nd & 11th Lords from 9th House • 2nd lord (Jupiter) and 11th lord (Mars) occupying the 9th house and casting aspect on Sun → powerful ancestral and wealth-linked karmic line. • This suggests the father was supported by family wealth and social gain (11H), likely finding influence through noble, governmental, or royal connections (9H). • This is a benefic aspectual yoga, allowing the father to rise in station via dharmic or kingly channels. Nadi Principle Insight • The paternal karmic stream is clear (Sun alone) and heavily supported by ancestral destiny (aspect from 9H). • 9th house placement of 2nd and 11th lords = karmic luck, gains, and respect earned through the dharmic line. • "மன்னர் மூலம் மேன்மை" (gains through royal patronage) implies the father's karma is tied to service or alliance with rulers—symbolically or actually. • The cutoff at age 22 shows a full karmic delivery of status and influence, followed by withdrawal or dissolution. • The native is born with an inherited karmic memory of paternal nobility, even if brief. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 3rd house → activates age 3, 15 • Jupiter (2nd lord) in 9th → age 9, 21 • Mars (11th lord) in 9th → age 11, 23 • At the age of 22, the native’s 10th house is activated. The 10th house becomes the 2nd house of maraka for the father. Its lord, Mars, is the primary maraka for the Libra sign due to ownership of the 2nd and 7th houses. Mars' position is not given in the verse. Jupiter is the 3rd lord of longevity from the 9th house. Hence, it can be assumed that Jupiter is in Visakha Nakshatra, which Jupiter also rules, and this placement is associated with the death of the father. ➤ The karmic cluster peaks at age 21–22, coinciding with the father’s departure. These years are pivotal for the native’s connection to paternal influence, even if indirect. Nadi Age Progression • Aspect from 9th to 3rd = karmic activation from father’s ancestral success to the native’s will/effort. • Father’s karma reaches culmination by 22, after which the karmic thread ceases. • 3rd house Sun = intellectual and communicative skill passed from father, especially between ages 15–22. Notes • The verse reflects a noble but time-limited paternal karma. • There is no affliction, but rather a dignified closure at 22. • The father’s dharmic rise is transferred subtly to the native, possibly through name, memory, or reputation.

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய பஞ்சம அஷ்டம கர்மாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானமேறிய உச்ச சனியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் ஐந்து, எல்லா மரணம், முப்பத்தாறில் பிதுர் கர்மமுண்டென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 3rd house, conjoined with the lords of the 3rd (siblings), 5th (children), 8th (longevity), and 10th (karma/profession), and aspected by exalted Saturn from the 9th house (house of ancestors). Interpretive Summary: This verse reflects a robust paternal lineage of five males, each marked by distinct karmic closures. The exalted Saturn’s aspect from the 9th house intensifies ancestral accountability, culminating in the father’s karmic departure at age thirty-six. The convergence of multiple house lords with the Sun suggests a densely woven karmic fabric influencing both lineage and timing. Traditional Astrology Analysis 3rd House – Sun with 3rd, 5th, 8th & 10th Lords • A dense planetary combination: o Sun (father, soul) o 3rd lord (Mars) → siblings, courage, karmic warfare o 5th lord (Mercury) → children, Purva punya o 8th lord (Moon) → longevity, hidden karma o 10th lord (Saturn) → profession, karma delivery • This rare mix in the 3rd house suggests a complex paternal karmic mandate: o A life filled with duty, risk, and ancestral weight. o The combination with the 8th lord ensures the karma is time-bound and intensely transformative. Aspect from Exalted Saturn (9th House) • Exalted Saturn in Libra in 9H casts a strong 3rd aspect. • Saturn as 10th lord in own/exalted state reinforces strict karmic accountability from ancestral dharma. • The aspect "seals" the karmic contract—indicating the father’s lineage is bound by heavy obligations, and his karma completes exactly at age 36. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun surrounded by 3rd, 5th, 8th, 10th lords: the father is the carrier of intense familial, karmic, and dharmic burdens. • "தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் ஐந்து" → indicates a lineage of five male members, each likely bound by the same karma (possibly brothers or ancestors), all facing death due to shared karmic threads. • Exalted Saturn in 9H is the karmic gatekeeper — his aspect is not harmful but precise and fate-sealing. • "முப்பத்தாறில் பிதுர் கர்மம்" = father’s karma ends not by accident, but at a preordained point of karmic exhaustion (age 36). Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 3rd → activates ages 3, 15, 27 • Mars (3rd lord) → ages 3, 15 • Mercury (5th lord) → ages 5, 17 • Moon (8th lord) → ages 8, 20 • Saturn (10th lord) → ages 10, 22, 34 ➤ Activations converge around ages 34–36, directly aligning with the verse’s prediction. Nadi Age Progression • The 3rd house’s intense planetary load suggests high karmic tension building by age 30, breaking by 36. • Saturn’s 3rd aspect enforces karmic maturation, predominantly from ages 33–36. Notes • This is a karmic culmination verse: the father bears not only personal karma but family-wide ancestral karma (5 males). • Age 36 is precise—the end of a karmic lineage chapter, possibly ending a shared cycle. • The native may carry continuation karma beyond the father’s age of 36.

மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் இறையவன் (குரு), கேது இவர்களுடன் கூடி லக்கினாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் பிதுர் வர்க்கம் மூன்று, மாதமொன்றில் தாயும் தந்தையு மரணமடைவார்களென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 3rd house, conjoined with Jupiter (divine wisdom) and Ketu (moksha karaka), and aspected by the Ascendant lord. This verse reflects a paternal lineage of three males and indicates the simultaneous death of both parents within a month. Interpretive Summary: The conjunction with Jupiter and Ketu suggests a spiritually charged karmic culmination, while the Ascendant lord’s aspect intensifies the immediacy and personal impact of the loss. Traditional Astrology Analysis 3rd House – Sun + Jupiter + Ketu • Sun in the 3rd house = father’s karmic thread expressed through valour, skill, or short journeys. • Jupiter (9th lord) here symbolises a dharmic lineage; father is linked with wisdom or religious path. • Ketu adds a strong spiritual and karmic dissolution theme, suggesting incomplete or renounced karmas. • Jupiter–Ketu–Sun together in 3H creates a conflicted configuration — divine potential but sudden cutoffs. Aspect from Lagna Lord (Saturn) • Saturn (Lagna lord) aspecting 3H from the 9th or 5th = active karmic witnessing. • While generally stabilising, Saturn's aspect on Ketu–Sun often seals karmic debt, especially if Saturn is slow-moving or retrograde. • Instead of protecting, Saturn here formalises the karmic exit of the parents. Nadi Principle Insight • Jupiter and Ketu with the Sun suggest the father comes from a spiritual or learned line, but one facing moksha-prone dissolution. • "பிதுர் வர்க்கம் மூன்று" → lineage spans three male generations, likely each completing or renouncing their karma. • From the Sun, the 3rd lord of siblings, Saturn, is powerful in its Moolatrikona signs and aspecting the Sun. Jupiter is the 3rd lord of siblings from the 9th house and is placed with the exalted Sun and in a friendly home. The Sun itself indicates the elder sibling from the 9th house. All three combinations have given three lineages for the father. • Sudden simultaneous loss of both mother and father within a month points to a severe karmic break, a restart of soul evolution for the native. • In Nadi astrology, beyond planetary combinations, the specific statement that the parents will die within a month or a short period is also rooted in certain intrinsic principles and interpretative guidelines. These principles help to convey the severity and inevitability of the outcome, even when the planetary indicators may not seem extremely dire at first glance. The reasons include: • Significance of Specific House-Lord Placements: In our example of Aquarius Lagna, Saturn is in the Lagna, which signifies a strong and impactful influence on the native's life, including significant events connected with health and death. When a malefic like Saturn occupies the Lagna, it indicates a serious adverse phase related to longevity or health. Specifically, in Nadi astrology, it can be interpreted as a potential trigger for rapid events concerning the health of parents. • Special Combination of Key Planets in the 3rd House: Jupiter, Ketu, and Sun together in the 3rd house may unusually represent a destructive or disruptive influence in the context of parental health and safety, especially if the natural significations (like Sun with Ketu indicating separation or loss, and Jupiter indicating the father or elderly figures) are considered. • Indicative of Critical and Imminent Events: Some verses in Nadi literature are very concise and use strong language like "within a month" to emphasise the imminence and severity of the outcome, not necessarily because the planetary combinations are the only factor, but because the timing and nature of the planetary influences suggest a critical, unavoidable event. They function as red flags highlighting that the event is near and inevitable. • Symbolic and Prescriptive Nature of Verses: Many verses are crafted to serve as warnings or to underscore the gravity of the planetary influences. The language can be metaphorical or absolute, aimed at alerting the native of the likelihood of swift events based on the combined effect of planetary positions and aspects. • In essence, the statement about the parents’ death within a month, despite the planetary configurations, is a combination of the astrological significance of the planets involved, their houses, and dasa/transit timing. It highlights the imminence and potential severity of the event, as understood in Nadi astrology, where such specific phrases are intended to warn and prepare the native for a near-future occurrence. • Saturn’s aspect shows that the native must carry forward both parental karmas, often under emotional and spiritual isolation. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 3rd → activates ages 3, 15 • Jupiter in 3rd → ages 9, 21 • Ketu in 3rd → activates karmic events unpredictably; likely around age 6–8 • Saturn aspect (as Lagna lord) → ages 10, 22 ➤ If the death of both parents happens during early childhood (as the verse implies), these activations fall between ages 3–8. Nadi Age Progression • The 3rd house, though a house of strength, when hosting Ketu + Sun + Guru, becomes a trigger point for ancestral detachment. • Such early loss marks a karmic baton-passing event, where the soul must evolve independent of parental guidance. Vimshottari Timing Consideration • Jupiter–Ketu or Ketu–Saturn or Saturn–Sun dasha likely during childhood can trigger abrupt, simultaneous parental exit. Notes • The simultaneous loss of both parents within a month is sporadic and deeply karmic. • The 3H cluster suggests that native is karmically chosen to sever ties from prior lineage and must rebuild identity through self-dharma. • Ketu in 3H with Sun = inherited spiritual debts, often cut off without closure.

மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் புலவன், கேதுவுடன் கூடி உச்ச சனியாலும், லாபமேறிய ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திர குருவாலும் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால், பிதுர் வர்க்கம் ஐந்தில் தீர்க்கம்-ஆணேகம், பெண்ணேகம்,பிதா சுகவாசியென்பர். Translation This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 3rd house, conjoined with Mercury (intellect) and Ketu (moksha karaka), and aspected by exalted Saturn and Jupiter in its sign from the 11th house (gains). This verse reflects a well-established paternal lineage of five members, comprising multiple siblings, with one male and one female, who have demonstrated enduring longevity. The father enjoys a life of comfort and stability. Interpretive Summary: The exalted Saturn and self-placed Jupiter lend karmic strength and material support, while the conjunction with Mercury and Ketu suggests a lineage enriched by intellect and spiritual depth. Traditional Astrology Analysis 3rd House – Sun + Mercury + Ketu • Sun in 3rd = strong karmic action and self-willed father. • Mercury (lord of the 5th and 8th) here enhances intelligence, speech, intellect, and logic — father may be a learned or scholarly person (pulavan). • Ketu introduces moksha-karma, suggesting the father holds spiritual knowledge or is disinterested in materialism. • This is a potent mix of mental brilliance (Mercury), spiritual disconnection (Ketu), and lineage karma (Sun) — indicating a wise, reserved, and possibly reclusive father. Exalted Saturn & Jupiter’s Aspects • Saturn exalted in Libra (9H): 3rd aspect falls on 3H → dharmic structure, discipline, longevity in paternal karma. • Jupiter in Sagittarius (own sign) in 11H: 5th aspect to 3H → benevolent gains and moral inheritance. • The dual benefic aspects (one slow, mature; one wise, expansive) neutralise Ketu’s cutting nature, supporting comfort and long life for the father. Nadi Principle Insight • Mercury + Ketu + Sun = father is a karmic transmitter of speech and knowledge; possible sage-like attributes. • Exalted Saturn's discipline + Jupiter's grace signals a father whose life is both structured and fulfilled, leading to Sukha vasi (a comfortable or prosperous end). • “பிதுர் வர்க்கம் ஐந்தில் தீர்க்கம் – ஆணேகம், பெண்ணேகம்” ➤ Paternal line has five members; male-dominated but includes a female presence — symbolic of balanced karmic flow in the lineage. • This is one of the rare "positive karma verses", showing completion, comfort, and knowledge-based fulfilment. Notes • This is a verse of fulfilment and karmic privilege. • Father is presented as spiritually evolved, intellectually prosperous, and socially stable. • Mercury + Ketu is traditionally tricky to balance, but here it is stabilised by Saturn and uplifted by Jupiter — a rare combination. Here’s a structured table capturing the astrological configuration of this verse. Verse Configuration Table: Paternal Lineage & Yogas Astrological Element Details & Interpretation 3rd House Configuration Sun (Pithru Karaka), Mercury, and Ketu conjoined — ancestral lineage with karmic and intellectual imprint 11th House Aspects on 3rd Exalted Saturn and own-sign Jupiter aspecting — contributes sibling indicators and longevity blessings. Sibling Count (Five Members) Mercury as 3rd lord from Sun and Moon; Saturn as 11th lord — dual linkage from multiple perspectives Longevity Indicators Ketu’s confluence and Saturn’s exalted aspect bestow long life to one male and one female sibling. Father’s Raja Yogas (Sun as Lagna) Saturn (10th lord) aspects Jupiter (9th lord) — classic Raja Yoga formation Saturn is also the 4th & 5th lord from Moon, exalted in the 9th house — comforts and auspicious rise for father. Material Well-being Combined aspect of benefics and karmic planets on the 3rd house — indicates comfort, dharma alignment. Philosophical Karma Alignment Ketu with Sun; Saturn's control from the 11th — continuity through ancestral karma and spiritual elevation Sun in 4th house-Taurus நான்காமிடம்

நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் தன லாபாதிபதியுடன் கூடி நீச்ச சந்திரனால் பார்க்கப்பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் ஏழு. பெண்ணொன்றில் தீர்க்கம் ஆணாறு. சப்தமாதிபன் புக்தியில் மாதுரு வர்க்கக் கர்மமுண்டென்பர். General J.P. Fabricius Dictionary gives the following meaning for the word ‘Karmam- கருமம்’ கருமம், s. act, action, கிரியை; 2. a work, occupation, business, தொழில்; 3. actions of previous birth, fate, முன்வினை; 4. religious ceremonies and actions; 5. magical enchantments (of 8 kinds) அஷ்ட கருமம்; 6. funeral ceremonies, உத்தரகிரியை;
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 4th house, conjoined with the lords of the 2nd (wealth) and 11th (gains) houses, Jupiter and aspected by a debilitated Moon (6th lord – disease). This verse reflects a paternal lineage of seven males and one female, with six males enjoying longevity. In the Antar Dasha of the 7th lord, there will be funeral ceremonies on the mother’s side. Interpretive Summary: The aspect of the debilitated Moon introduces karmic strain through maternal or emotional channels. The mention of the 7th lord’s bhukti suggests that karmic consequences related to the maternal lineage may unfold during that period. Traditional Astrology Analysis 4th House – Sun + 2nd + 11th Lords • Sun in 4th = karma related to property, homeland, inner emotional fabric of the native and their father. • 2nd lord (Jupiter) and 11th lord (Mars) conjoined with the Sun indicate: o Father is materially endowed, with support from family wealth and social networks. o Strong link to inheritance, landed property, and legacy comforts. Aspect of Debilitated Moon (6th Lord) • Moon (debilitated, i.e., in Scorpio) as lord of disease, debt, and enmity, casting aspect from the 10th house (karma). • This is a malefic and draining influence: o Causes emotional instability or early affliction to the father’s health. o Suggests loss or struggle in domestic/emotional matters, possibly hidden ailments or karmic debts paid through illness. 7th Lord's Bhukti Mentioned • Activation of karma during the 7th lord's Dasha or Bhukti implies: o Involvement of maraka effects (death-inflicting) o Strong link to maternal lineage karma due to the 4H/10H Moon–Sun link. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun in 4H with 2nd & 11th lords: Father is karmically associated with comforts, prosperity, and familial heritage. • Moon’s debility marks the weakening of maternal care or nourishment, making the father’s position secure externally but fragile emotionally or physically. • “தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் ஏழு… தீர்க்கம் ஆணாறு” → karmic pruning of male lineage. One male's life is cut short, marking ancestral imbalance. • My logic for the seven male members: Sun-1, Sun + Jupiter-1, Jupiter as 11th lord from Sun-1, Jupiter as 3rd lord from 9th house-1, Moon as 3rd lord from Sun-1, Aspect of Moon who becomes a lord of sibling-1, Aspect of Jupiter and Sun-both are sibling lords on Moon-another sibling lord-1 making a total of seven. • One male's life is short- because Moon representing one sibling is debilitated and is placed in the 2nd house of maraka from the 9th house. The 2nd lord from the Moon is Jupiter, and its aspect on the Moon reduces the longevity of one sibling. • 7th lord’s Antar dasha brings maternal family karma to the surface, possibly related to property, debts, or female figures (mother, maternal uncles, aunts). • 7th lord’s Antar Dasha is the timing for maternal lineage Karma, as Sun, who is the Antar Dasha lord, aspects the Moon and is conjoined with Jupiter. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 4th → activates age 4, 16, 28 • Moon (6th lord) → ages 6, 18, 30 • Jupiter (2nd lord) → age 2, 14, 26 • Mars (11th lord) → age 11, 23, 35 ➤ Karmic disruption expected between ages 18–28, with the strongest possibility around Mars–Moon or Moon–Mars cycles. Nadi Progression Insight • The 4th house activation triggers maternal karmas strongly by age 28. • Since 7th lord = maraka, Dasha–Bhukti of that planet around late 20s or early 30s can reactivate buried family karma. Notes • Despite material comfort, this verse signals a fragile karmic thread in the paternal line. • One male ancestor’s early loss mirrors the native’s spiritual test or karmic reminder. • Moon’s debility subtly erodes the stability offered by Jupiter and Mars — the karma is not about wealth, but emotional burden and ancestral fatigue.

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் பஞ்சம ரோக அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி குடும்பமேறிய ஜென்ம விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டால் ஜேஷ்ட பிதா பதினெட்டில் குலமாருவான், தந்தை இருபதிற்குள் மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 4th house, conjoined with the lords of the 5th (children)-Mercury, 6th (disease)-Moon, and 8th (longevity)-Mercury houses, and aspected by the 12th lord (loss)-Saturn from the 2nd house (family). This verse reflects a karmic shift in lineage, where the elder paternal figure transitions at age eighteen, and the father dies before the native reaches twenty. Interpretive Summary: The aspect of the 12th lord toward the house of family underscores ancestral dissolution. In contrast, the conjunction of disease and longevity lords with the Sun intensifies the theme of early paternal departure and generational restructuring. Traditional Astrology Analysis 4th House: Sun + Mercury + Moon • Sun = Pitrukaraka in the 4H → links father to home, property, and emotional foundation. • Mercury (5th + 8th lord) → intelligence, legacy, AND hidden karmic triggers; represents both blessing and burden. • Moon (6th lord) → brings disease karma, mental instability, and service-related burdens. • Together, this trio points to a father with ancestral intelligence, but karmically overburdened, especially with debts and health issues. Saturn (12th lord) Aspects from 2H • Saturn here is the karaka for loss, detachment, and longevity constraints. • From the family house, its aspect to the 4H shows: o Loss of paternal connection within the domestic/family space o Karma of withdrawal from the home lineage, possibly due to displacement or karmic exhaustion • This leads to transfer of responsibility to the eldest uncle — a karmic "reset" at age 18. Nadi Principle Insight • Mercury (8th lord) and Moon (6th lord) with Sun → the father carries multiple karmic liabilities, especially illness and lineage exhaustion. • Sun in 4H reflects a father rooted in domestic karma, yet destined for early departure. • “ஜேஷ்ட பிதா குலமாருவான்” = karmic continuation shifts to elder uncle → indicating father’s karmic cycle ends abruptly. •   Saturn in the 11th (older sibling) and aspecting Jupiter (11th lord) suggests the elder sibling as the karmic pivot. • Sun in 4th conjoined with Mercury and Moon → ancestral karma entangled with disease and longevity themes. • Saturn’s aspect from the 2nd house (family) to the 4th house (Sun) implies ancestral dissolution via family karma. • Verse’s statement “ஜேஷ்ட பிதா பதினெட்டில் குலமாருவான்” aligns with lineage shift at age 18, possibly due to elder sibling assuming karmic responsibility. • This is a clear ancestral energy transfer verse: the Sun burns its karma early, and the torch passes to another bearer. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 4th → activates ages 4, 16, 28 • Mercury (5th/8th) → 5, 17 • Moon (6th lord) → 6, 18 • Saturn (12th lord) → 12, 24 ➤ Ages 17–18 become highly sensitive due to the combined Moon-Mercury and Saturn aspect timing, aligning with the predicted karmic death of the father. The age of 20 for the native is the death of the father. The 4th house is activated at this stage of life. As per the Deva Keralam rule, the 4th house planets are responsible for the death of the father. The sun placed there indicates the father. Moon conjoining the Sun indicates longevity of the father, being the 3rd lord from the Sun. Mercury placed there is the 2nd lord of maraka from the Sun and also the 12th house of exit from the 9th house of father. Saturn aspecting is the karaka for longevity, and it owns the 9th house of badhaka sthana from the Sun. Nadi Activation • Saturn’s influence denotes fading paternal karma by 18, and mercurial inheritance (Mercury as 5th/8th lord) suggests transformation via intellectual or spiritual legacy, not physical presence. Likely Dasha Influence • Periods like Moon–Mercury, Mercury–Saturn, or Saturn–Moon could be responsible for triggering the shift. Notes • Father’s life span is short due to the simultaneous 6th and 8th lords afflicting the Sun. • Saturn's gaze from 2H causes ancestral detachment through karmic loss, not tragedy — it’s a pre-written transition. • Uncle becomes karmic torchbearer, initiating a new phase of lineage leadership at age 18. • This is a classic “transfer verse” in Eswara Nadi — illustrating karmic succession, not just biological inheritance.

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி தசம கேந்திரமேறிய ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திர குஜனால் பார்க்கப்பட்டிருந்தால் ஜாதகன் ஊமையாவான். இருபத்தைந்திற்குள் தந்தை மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 4th house, conjoined with the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses-Mercury, and aspected by Mars (10th lord – karma/profession) from its sign in a Kendra (angular house). Interpretive Summary: This verse reflects a karmic imprint of speech impairment in the native, possibly symbolic of ancestral silence or unresolved lineage expression. The father dies before the native reaches age twenty-five. The aspect of self-placed Mars in a Kendra intensifies karmic action, while the conjunction with the 8th lord reinforces themes of early paternal departure. Traditional Astrology Analysis 4th House – Sun + Mercury (5th & 8th Lord) • Sun in 4H: Associated with father’s emotional, property, and homeland karma. • Mercury as 5th and 8th lord → highly sensitive: o 5H = intellect, speech, learning o 8H = loss, transformation, secret suffering ✦ The conjunction affects both the karmic channel of progeny and the speech centre, especially in Mercury’s domain (communication). ♂ Mars (10th Lord) Aspect from Own Kendra • Mars (10th lord) aspects the 4th from Aries or Scorpio (own signs, both Kendras). • This forms a powerful directional influence, but also: o Agitates the mind (Mars on Mercury) o Causes sharp karmic breaks in speech, intelligence, or paternal stability • Mars, though in its sign, becomes karmically aggressive when aspecting Mercury + Sun. Nadi Principle Insight • This is a strong karmic blockage verse. The Sun–Mercury conjunction aspected by Mars cuts off the speech-karma channel. • The native is rendered mute not just physically, but symbolically muted in expressing ancestral identity. • The father’s karma, entwined with the native’s loss of communication, ends by age 25 — a peak karmic transfer window. • Mars in its sign = ancestral karma is forceful, dharmic, but aggressive, pushing both native and father toward abrupt karmic separation. Age-Wise Activation BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Sun in 4H → ages 4, 16, 28 • Mercury (5th/8th) → ages 5, 17 • Mars (10th lord) → 10, 22, 34 ➤ Converging influence between ages 22–25, especially Mercury–Mars or Mars–Mercury dashas, activates both: • Speech-karma interruption • Father's death window Nadi Timing Logic • Mars activating Mercury–Sun in 4H = agni-karma ignition → either through speech loss or ancestral rupture. • Karmic culmination aligns with father’s karmic exit between age 22–25. Vimshottari Dasha Indicators • Likely periods: Mercury–Mars, Mars–Sun, or Sun–Mercury — all tying communication and karmic dissolution. Notes • “ஊமையாவான்” is not merely physical muteness, but symbolic of ancestral disconnection through communication breakdown. • Mercury's dual role (5H and 8H) binds speech and life-span karma tightly; its affliction by Mars is definitive. • Mars in Kendra from own house is karmically strong but uncompromising — it severs threads no longer needed for soul growth. • The native may inherit spiritual or intuitive depth, even if speech is cut off externally.

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் சனியிருந்தால், பிதாவுடன் பெண்ணொன்று. பிதா நாளுக்கு நாள் விர்த்தியாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 4th house, conjoined with the lords of the 5th (children) and 8th (longevity) houses, Mercury, while Saturn occupies the 9th house (house of ancestors). Interpretive Summary: This verse reflects a paternal lineage that includes one sister alongside the father. The father's life is marked by gradual and steady progression. Traditional Astrology Analysis 1. Exalted Saturn in 9th – Steady Rise Through Dharma • Saturn as Lagna lord exalted in the 9th (Libra) signifies slow but assured karmic elevation. • The 9th house governs fortune, dharma, and father’s prosperity — Saturn here ensures day-by-day growth, aligning with “நாளுக்கு நாள் விர்த்தி”. 2. Sun in 4th – Father’s Comfort and Status • Sun in Sukha Bhava (4th) reflects domestic stability and paternal well-being. • As karaka for father, its placement in a foundational house suggests material and emotional support. 3. Mercury in 4th – Intellectual Legacy and Land Link • Mercury adds transactional intelligence, possibly indicating land-based prosperity or educational upliftment. • Its dual lordship (5th & 8th) brings legacy and longevity themes into the father’s karmic arc. 4. Saturn’s Aspectual Influence • Saturn in 9th aspects the 3rd, 6th, and 11th houses, subtly energising effort, service, and gains — all contributing to the father’s progressive rise. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun represents the father. Mercury joining the Sun indicates a female sibling, as Mercury is of a dual nature • Saturn in the 9H shows ancestral karma crystallising into suffering — not explosive, but erosive. • Saturn in the 9th house in Libra indicates a disciplined, steady approach to higher education, religion, or paternal matters, and signifies gradual but consistent progress. The influence on maternal relatives, especially the father’s sister, remains positive, and life unfolds in a step-by-step manner, emphasising perseverance and patience.

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சந்திரன், புதன், ராகு இவர்களுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை வீரியமேறிய சுக பாக்கியாதிபதியால் நோக்கப்பட்டால் பிதாவுடன் பெண்ணொன்று. பிதா சன்மார்க்கனாயும் பூமி தொழிலுள்ளவனாயு மிருப்பனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: This configuration places the Sun (significator of ancestors) in the 4th house, conjoined with the Moon (6th lord – disease), Mercury (intellect), and Rahu (Gyana karaka). In contrast, the 9th house (house of ancestors) is aspected by a strong 4th and 9th lord from a position of strength. This verse reflects a paternal lineage that includes one sister alongside the father. Interpretive Summary: The father is portrayed as a righteous individual engaged in land-based occupations. The conjunction of Moon, Mercury, and Rahu suggests a blend of emotional depth, intellectual sharpness, and karmic complexity. At the same time, the aspect of a strong Sukha–Bhagya lord reinforces themes of dharmic livelihood and moral stature. Traditional Astrology Analysis 4th House – Sun + Moon + Mercury + Rahu • This planetary crowding in the 4th house creates complex domestic karma. • Sun (Pitrukaraka) in 4H = ties father to homeland, property, foundational karma. • Moon (6th lord) → injects disease/service elements into paternal role; a father who suffers quietly, yet serves family deeply. • Mercury brings intellect, skill, and dharma-conscious thinking. • Rahu, though a malefic, when with Moon & Mercury, produces: o A sharp thinker, but often one facing distortions in perception, mental conflict, or public misunderstanding. • Net Result: Father is intelligent, possibly involved in land, property, or education, but experiences inner conflict or a silent burden. 9th House – Strong Aspect from 4th & 9th Lord • Most likely Venus (lord of 4th and 9th in Aquarius Lagna) is aspecting 9H from its own or exalted sign. • This fortifies the ancestral karma: o Venus = dharmic grace, ethical conduct, and sanmargam (righteous path). o Aspect on 9H = father has spiritual values and moral clarity. Nadi Principle Insight • This is a composite karma verse – merging material, mental, and spiritual threads. • Father’s karma is anchored in righteousness, not necessarily fame or wealth. • Rahu + Mercury = suggests a spiritually inclined, possibly landed intellectual or village administrator. • Presence of a sister – Moon is the 3rd lord from the Sun, and Venus, another female planet, is placed before Moon, suggesting this. • Father's life is not cut short here — instead, he lives a whole, dharmic life, managing inner challenges while being karmically productive.
