உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் நட்புபெற்று சுக கேந்திரமேறிய பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதியை  ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திர ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தையுடன் ஆண் நான்கு, பெண்ணொன்று. தந்தை இருபத்தொன்பதில் மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: When the Sun is alone in the Ascendant (Pisces), gaining strength by being in the friendly sign of Jupiter, and the 9th lord Mars is placed in a Kendra (4th house), receiving an aspect from Jupiter, who is both the Ascendant and 10th lord, and is in its sign, → then the father has four male siblings and one female sibling, → and the native’s father dies at the age of 29. Traditional Insight • Sun alone in Lagna indicates karmic imprint of the father dominating identity. • Mars (9th lord) in the Kendra (4th) reflects paternal support and ancestral grace, influencing Sukha. • Jupiter in own sign (Virgo) as Lagna + Karma lord, aspecting 4th house, reinforces blessings and sustains Mars. • This triangulation ensures the father's karma is strong, with a dharmic legacy, yet concludes by age 29, when the karmic window closes. Sibling Enumeration Logic The verse mentions: “தந்தையுடன் ஆண் நான்கு, பெண்ணொன்று” i.e. Along with the father, four males and one female in the paternal lineage. Here's the derived reasoning based on planetary logic: Indicator Reasoning Mars in dual sign (Gemini) Dual signs indicate duplication – Mars as a sibling karaka gives two male siblings. Mars aspects Jupiter Adds another male sibling (Jupiter = paternal dharma & male benefic) Father One male (Sun as 9th significator) Mars’ 8th aspect → Aquarius Aquarius (a female sign) = 1 female sibling Total = 3 males (siblings) + father = 4 males, 1 female sibling This method mirrors the Nadi numerological tradition, where karaka placement, sign gender, and aspect range define familial structure. The use of sign gender (Aquarius = female) and aspect precision is a key hallmark of Nadi sibling derivation. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun in Lagna = direct ancestral karma imprint • Mars (9th lord) = strong in a Kendra (Gemini), creates root karmas related to Sukha (house/land) • Jupiter's aspect indicates the native has inherited paternal punya but also a fixed karmic clock — death of father at age 29 is tied to the exhaustion of that dharma. • Such verses indicate intergenerational sequencing: first, dharma is inherited (Sun-Mars), then transferred (father’s death) when the native’s karma must activate independently. BCP / Nadi Progression at Age 29 • 29th year → 5th house activation (Cancer) • From Pisces Lagna, Cancer = house of children and merit, ruled by Moon • From Sun (in Pisces), Cancer is also the 5th house – indicates legacy triggers • Likely involvement of Moon or 6th lord (disease/maraka) in progression – representing final activation of paternal karma and closure Timing of Father’s Death – Maraka Logic via Jupiter’s Progression While the verse specifies death at age 29, the deeper timing mechanism can be understood through Jupiter’s role as a maraka for the 9th house (father), using Nadi progression logic and karaka dynamics: Jupiter’s Role as Maraka • Jupiter is the 2nd lord from the 9th house (Scorpio) — i.e., Sagittarius becomes the 2nd house from the 9th, and Jupiter owns Sagittarius. • In karaka-based maraka theory, the 2nd and 7th from any house can indicate exit/death. Hence, Jupiter is the primary maraka for the father based on its ownership from the 9th house. Progression Logic (Bhrigu Chakra / Nadi Age Progression) • Jupiter returns to its natal house every 12 years, so by age 24, it has completed two cycles. • By age 29, Jupiter in its third cycle might reach the 5th house (Aries) — the house of activation in that year. Death Trigger Combination Let’s analyse Jupiter's placement relative to the Sun and the 9th house: Relation Effect Jupiter is 2nd lord from 9th Maraka's role for father Jupiter is placed 2nd from the Sun. (In progress) Triggers maraka effect on Sun = father Jupiter is 7th from 9th house (Aries → Scorpio) Direct maraka placement (7th = death-inflicting axis in Nadi) Conclusion This verse powerfully illustrates a case where the father’s strong dharmic life (Mars-Jupiter pattern) culminates in a karmic turning point for the native. • A well-defined sibling constellation using traditional and Nadi metrics • Father’s death at age 29 is not accidental but rather an activated karmic junction • A highly structured example of paternal karma peaking and transferring

TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி ஒன்பதாமாதிபதியான குஜன் பனிரண்டாமிடமேறியிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகன். ஜாதகனுக்கு ஐம்பதில் தந்தை மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in Pisces Lagna and is conjoined with the Sukha and 7th house lord Mercury, and the 9th lord Mars is placed in the 12th house in Aquarius. Father will be a lone member. At the age of 50, the native father dies, Interpretation & Analysis 1. Siblings and Paternal Lineage Insight: • Mars, the 9th lord, is alone in the 12th, a house of exit, renunciation, and solitude. • This often denotes isolation or detachment from paternal lineage, leading to the interpretation of the father being a lone sibling or estranged from family. • No strong conjunctions or aspects suggest absence of sibling support or karmic isolation. 2. Nature of Father: • Sun in Lagna makes the father central to the native’s identity, but Mercury’s presence (4th/7th lord) modifies the paternal archetype: o Intellectual, communicative, possibly dual nature. o In Pisces, Mercury is debilitated — indicating conflicted domestic/spousal energies, potentially mirrored in the father’s life. • Mars in the 12th, being the 9th lord, suggests a spiritual inclination or hidden karma of the father, potentially away from the family. Timing Logic – Age 50 Mars as 9th lord in 12th: • The 12th house from Lagna is the 4th from the 9th, representing the end of life (moksha sthana) for the father. • Mars here signifies active karma or suffering in the house of exit, indicating a long-lived father who passes away after fulfilling dharmic duties. • Also, Mars is in the 12th house of Exit from the Sun. BCP Check (Optional) • At age 50, the 2nd house (Aries) is activated by BCP. • Aries is ruled by Mars (9th lord) — a maraka for father, now in 12th. • Sun (karaka for father) receives this indirect trigger via its connection with Mars. Conclusion (Summary Table Row) Verse Planetary Position Summary Result Death Age Logic 2 Sun + Mercury in Lagna; Mars (9th lord) in 12th Father is solitary; dies at age 50 Mars in 12H (exit); BCP 2H = Aries ruled by Mars

TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஞானகாரகனுடன் கூடி சப்தம கேந்திரமேறிய பஞ்சமாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப்பட்டால் தந்தை வர்க்க மூன்றில் தந்தையே விர்த்தி, தந்தைக்குக் களத்திரமிரண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Pitrukaraka conjoins Jnana karaka, Rahu (significator of wisdom/intellect) in Lagna. • The 5th lord aspects this conjunction from the 7th Kendra The result of this planetary configuration is that out of the three paternal lineages of the native, only the father progresses. Father will have two wives. 1. Sun + Rahu in Lagna (Pisces): • Sun signifies father, and Rahu, when conjoined, amplifies karmic patterns and creates nonlinear life events. • In Pisces, this conjunction accentuates the spiritual-karma trajectory of the paternal line. • The father becomes the torchbearer among siblings – only he sustains livelihood or carries forward the karmic legacy. 2. Moon (5th lord) in 7th house (Virgo): • The 5th house is associated with children, past life merit, and wisdom. • Moon as 5th lord in 7th directly aspects Lagna (Sun + Rahu), activating past-life merit through relationship-based karma. • Moon in Virgo is analytical but also emotional — indicates marital fluctuations or emotional intensity. • Result: The father has two marriages – Rahu often causes separation or multiplicity in relationships. 3. Siblings Logic – Traditional and Nadi Integration: • Mars, the karaka for siblings, is not actively involved in this verse, suggesting a lack of support from other paternal siblings. • The phrase “தந்தை வர்க்க மூன்றில் தந்தையே விர்த்தி” is interpreted as: o Among three males in the paternal lineage, only the native's father progresses economically/livelihood-wise. o Others either remain static, renounce, or are karmically blocked. Progression & BCP Activation Insight Jupiter Progression: • Progression logic is not explicitly linked to a death event in this verse. • Instead, Jupiter or Rahu progression can relate to triggering events like marriage, spiritual vocation, or separation (dual marriage logic). BCP Insight: • No specific age is mentioned. • If the 5th house is activated (e.g., age 5, 17, 29...), the Moon's energy manifests. • Moon aspects Sun-Rahu, triggering life-defining karmic patterns of the father, such as second marriage or profession-based changes. Conclusion (Summary Table Row) Verse Planetary Position Summary Result 3 Sun + Rahu in Lagna; 5th lord Moon in 7th aspecting Lagna Out of 3 paternal lineages, only the father earns a livelihood; the father has two marriages Bottom of Form

TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய சுக சப்தம அஷ்டமாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி ரோகமேறிய தன பாக்கியாதியால் பார்க்கப்பட்டால் ஜாதகன் பிறந்த இரண்டு மாதத்தில் தந்தை குடும்பம் விட்டு தேசாந்திரம் போவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In Pisces Lagna, the pitrukaraka Sun is conjoined with the third and eighth lord Venus, the fourth and the seventh lord Mercury, all occupying the ascendant. This conjunction is aspected by the second and ninth lord, Mars, placed in the sixth house. As a result of this configuration, the native’s father departs from the family and relocates to a distant place within two months of the native’s birth. Traditional Insights • The Sun in Lagna often makes the father central to the native’s destiny, especially karmically. • Venus (3rd & 8th) and Mercury (4th & 7th) in Lagna show emotional disruption related to family, siblings, or marital factors in early life. • Mars’ aspect is powerful and disruptive: o Mars is both the 9th lord (father) and the 2nd lord (family) – indicating a break or shift in the familial setup. o From the 6th house, its drishti to Lagna is hostile and karmically triggered, possibly due to enmity, debts, or past-life obligations. Nadi and Symbolic Interpretation • The Lagna confluence represents a dense karmic knot involving father, domestic peace, siblings, and longevity issues. • The aspect from Mars—the fiery karaka of force and separation—activates the karmic departure of the father. • The 8th house ownership of Venus, combined with Mars’ 6th house placement, creates a hidden or sudden karmic push for migration or separation. • The presence of Mercury, lord of the 4th (home), in Lagna shows that the native’s early life/home is involved directly in this break. Timing Analysis: Why 2 months? Option 1: BCP Activation (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • At 2 months, the 2nd house is activated (based on monthly progression). • The 2nd house (Aries) is ruled by Mars, which is: o The 9th lord (father’s karma) o Aspecting Lagna, where Sun (father) sits o From the 6th house, causes departure due to strife or karmic burden Option 2: Planetary Progression Insight • Mars, representing father (9th lord), progresses to aspect Venus and Mercury—highlighting departure or forced separation. • The 6th house (Leo) is the 12th from 7th, showing separation from spouse (possibly the mother of the native). • In Nadi-style progression, such a configuration at the 2nd month (Mars’ house being activated) corresponds with the karmic separation event. Summary of Results • Father is shown to be karmically affected by both the Lagna placement of significators and the Mars aspect. • The departure from family is not due to death, but migration or estrangement. • This may also suggest the father remains alive and influential from afar—possibly due to work, conflict, or renunciation. Conclusion This verse presents a deeply karmic snapshot where multiple significators converge in the Lagna under a hostile aspect from Mars. The early departure of the father is not coincidental but part of a precise karmic equation, triggered around the 2nd month by Mars’ activation as lord of both the 9th (father) and 2nd (family/lineage).

TamilVerse: உதையத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் பஞ்சமாதிபதி நீச்சனாயிருந்தால், ஜாதகன் பிதுர், மாதுர் கர்மம், அன்னிய கர்மம் செய்வனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in Lagna (Pisces). Venus, lord of the 3rd and 8th houses, is conjoined with the Sun in the Ascendant. Moon, the 5th lord, is debilitated in Scorpio, occupying the 9th house (house of father and dharma). The native is destined to perform funeral/ritualistic karmas for the father, mother, and others (non-family individuals), indicating a deep karmic engagement with death-related duties. Traditional Astrological Insights Planet House Role Position Sun Karaka Father 1st house (Pisces) Venus 3rd & 8th lord Siblings, longevity 1st house (with Sun) Moon 5th lord Purva Punya, rituals 9th house (Scorpio), debilitated • Venus, as the 8th lord, represents endings, inheritance, and death-related karmas. • Moon, signifying rituals, placed debilitated in the 9th house, indicates emotional burden and responsibility for ancestral karma. • The Sun-Venus conjunction in Lagna denotes that the native is deeply tied to ancestral karmas. Nadi Perspective • Sun (Pitrukaraka) and Venus (8th lord) together in Lagna form a karmic ignition point — suggesting obligation to resolve the father's karmas. • The Moon, though a benefic, being debilitated in Scorpio (a sign of secrecy, death, occult), reflects a heavy emotional inheritance. • The 5th house governs rituals, memory, and accumulated karma (Purva Punya). The lord Moon being in a complex condition implies that the native must repay or resolve debts through rituals. Interpretive Insights • Performing karmas for both parents (Sun–Venus + Moon combo) shows a sole responsibility falling on the native. • "அன்னிய கர்மம்" (karmas for others) suggests: o The native might become a ritual specialist, undertaker, or someone performing last rites for people with no family. o Or he may be emotionally or karmically drawn to situations involving death and transition. Timing Outlook (Optional) • Although no specific age is given, we may infer activation periods: o BCP method: • 9th house (Scorpio) is activated in the 9th year – at which point Moon’s role as 5th lord is crucial. o Planetary progression: • Moon Dasha or sub-periods during Scorpio transits may trigger these karmic events. Summary Feature Detail Lagna Pisces Key Conjunction Sun (Pitrukaraka) + Venus (3rd & 8th lord) in Lagna Debilitated Planet Moon (5th lord) in 9th house Karmic Result Native performs death rituals for father, mother, and others. Spiritual Implication Strong ancestral karma; likely dharmic atonement through rituals Sun in 2nd house, Aries இரண்டாமிடம்

TamilVerse: இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் உச்சம் பெற்று, உச்ச லாப விரையாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டால் தந்தையுடன் ஆண் மூன்று, பெண்ணிரண்டு. தந்தைக்குத் தாரமிரண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is alone in the 2nd house (Aries) and is exalted. Saturn, exalted and aspecting the Sun, is the lord of the 11th (labha – gains) and 12th (loss/separation) houses, placed in the 8th house (Libra). This planetary setup indicates: • Father is accompanied by three male siblings and two female siblings. • Father has two wives. Traditional Astrology Analysis Planet House Role Status Sun 2nd Pitrukaraka Exalted in Aries Saturn 8th 11th & 12th lord Exalted in Libra, aspects the 2nd house (Sun) Interpretative Insights: • Sun exalted in the 2nd (family/lineage) signifies a powerful paternal influence, prominent lineage, or respected family head. • Saturn's exalted aspect brings structure, but also separation, due to its 12th house ownership and 8th placement (a house of death/legacy). Saturn’s cold nature also supports the possibility of two marriages or family division. Nadi Principles Interpretation • The 2nd house is the Kutumba Sthana, indicating family, food, wealth, and continuity. • The Sun alone in exaltation here reflects a dominant yet solitary paternal role, possibly with fragmented responsibilities between two families. • Saturn’s aspect (lord of loss and gain) to the exalted Sun suggests: o Gain through family lineage, o Separation or karmic duality in marital life (hence two spouses). Siblings Analysis The verse states three male and two female children. • Mars, the karaka for siblings, owns the 2nd house (Aries) where Sun is exalted – signifying strength in paternal lineage. • Saturn is the lord of the 11th house from the Sun and the lord of the 3rd house from the 9th house. • Saturn is exalted. Saturn is dualistic, and it rules a male and a female sign. Hence, it implies: o Multiple siblings, o Mixed gender results. This karmic imbalance produces three male and two female siblings accompanying the father. Marriage Indicator – Father’s Dual Spouses • Saturn’s role is key: its ownership of the 11th (desires as well as marriage) and 12th (separation, loss) suggests that: o The first marriage might end due to karma or health (12th), o The second arises to fulfil social or material duties (11th). o Saturn is placed in the 7th house of marriage from the Sun. • Being exalted in the 8th house (longevity, legacy), Saturn enforces a transformative marriage pattern. Age-Wise Activation – BCP & Planetary Progression While this verse does not specify an age for the father's death, we may examine activation cycles: • 2nd House Activation: Occurs at age two by BCP. As Sun is exalted, this may mark: o The beginning of lineage responsibilities, or o A ritual related to the father’s prominence. • Saturn’s progression: By the father's 50s or 60s, Saturn might move to Cancer (aspecting Lagna or 9th). Given its 8th placement, this may suggest late-life transformations, including marriage-related shifts. Summary Feature Description Lagna Pisces Pitrukaraka Sun in 2nd (Aries), exalted Aspecting Planet Saturn (11th/12th lord), exalted in 8th (Libra) Siblings 3 males, two females Father’s Marital Status 2 spouses Interpretation Father is prominent, may have dual families or karmic marriage shifts—rich ancestral and family legacy with responsibility over multiple dependents.

TamilVerse: இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன்  சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி, பிதுர் ஸ்தனத்தை ஆரல், ஆசான் சேர்ந்து பார்த்தால் தந்தை எட்டு வயதில் மரணமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In the 2nd house, to Pisces Lagna, Sun is placed with the 4th and 7th lord Mercury, and the 9th house is aspected by Mars and Jupiter. The father will die at the age of eight for the native. Traditional Astrology Interpretation Planet Placement House Lordship (from Pisces) Nature Sun 2nd house (Aries) Pitrukaraka Exalted Mercury 2nd house (Aries) 4th & 7th lord Neutral/Maraka Mars 3rd house (Taurus) 2nd & 9th lord Malefic Jupiter 3rd house (Taurus) 1st & 10th lord Benefic Key Features: • Sun exalted in Aries = strong lineage, proud heritage. • Mercury, lord of 7th (maraka), in close conjunction = maraka energy overlays father. • Mars (9th lord) and Jupiter (1st lord) aspect 9th house (Scorpio) – the house of father, bringing both karma and dharma energies. • Mars, being the 9th lord and aspecting its own house, adds weight to father-related karma. Nadi Astrology Insight • 2nd house: Represents family lineage and speech. Sun here shows lineage continuation, but Mercury (maraka) disturbs the pattern. • 9th house (Scorpio) becomes a karmic battlefield: o Mars, the owner of 9th, aspects its own house — usually signifies karma coming full circle. o But its conjunction with Jupiter makes the impact dharma-bound yet terminal. • The Sun–Mercury in Aries conjunction is overpowered by Mars-Jupiter’s aspect to the 9th, particularly because Mars owns the house it aspects, lending more activation energy. Timing Analysis (BCP + Planetary Progression) 🔹 BCP at Age 8: • 8th house is Libra (ruled by Venus). • The 8th house becomes the 7th house of maraka from the Sun. • More critically, 8th house activation aligns with longevity-related events. 🔹 Jupiter Progression: • Jupiter moves ~1 sign/year. • In 8 years, Jupiter would have reached Sagittarius, which is the 2nd house of maraka from the 9th house of the father. Karmic & Psychological Insight • Father is likely a strong, self-made person with minimal emotional support (Sun exalted, Mercury–Sun logic-driven). • Mars–Jupiter aspecting the 9th shows that the father’s dharmic journey is intense and likely ends in early departure. • Native inherits intellectual skills (Mercury) but faces emotional detachment due to early loss of paternal protection. Summary Table Feature Placement Lagna Pisces Sun (Pitrukaraka) 2nd house (Aries), exalted With Mercury (4th & 7th lord – maraka) Mars & Jupiter 3rd house (Taurus) Aspect Mars-Jupiter aspecting 9th (Scorpio) Karma Strong paternal karma; premature exit Timing Death of father at age 8 Progression Confirmed by BCP (8th house activation) and Jupiter progression

TamilVerse: இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக்கிரன் கேதுவுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதியான குஜன் மூன்றாமிடமே றியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்க மூவரிலொருவன் அன்னிய தேச மாரலாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 2nd house (Aries). • It is conjoined with: o Venus, ruler of the 3rd and 8th houses. o Ketu, the karmic moksha karaka. • Mars, the 9th lord (significator of father), is placed in the 3rd house (Taurus). • Result: Among three paternal males, one dies in a foreign country, indicating karmic displacement and distant culmination. Traditional Astrological Interpretation Planet House (from Lagna) Role Significance Sun 2nd (Aries) Pitrukaraka Lineage, ego Venus 2nd 3rd & 8th Lord Longevity, siblings Ketu 2nd Moksha karaka Disruption, severance Mars 3rd (Taurus) 2nd & 9th Lord Wealth & Father • Sun–Venus–Ketu in the 2nd house indicate a karmic disturbance in the family line, with Ketu cutting ties or leading to displacement or separation. • Mars, the 9th lord, in 3rd house, is significant: o The 3rd house governs efforts, communication, and short journeys. o Mars in Taurus shows aggressive karma being played out in a stable, earthy zone. o Placement in the 3rd also hints at a father or paternal relative being mobile or restless, possibly leaving the homeland. • Venus (8th lord) with Sun afflicts the father, while Ketu indicates fatal foreign karma. Nadi Insight • The 2nd house shows speech, family, and continuation of lineage. • Sun-Venus-Ketu creates a break in family pattern — a paternal figure experiences separation from family and death abroad. • The presence of Ketu amplifies the moksha or finality in a non-native place. • Mars in 3rd shows a karmic shift via effort — possibly through work or war (Mars) that leads to death abroad. Interpretation of the Result "Among three paternal members, one dies in a foreign land." • Paternal lineage = 3 males: could be father + two uncles or male relatives. • Mars, the karaka for siblings placed next to Sun and Venus, signifies three siblings to the father; Ketu, sitting there, separates one sibling. • One experiences death away from home, suggesting: o Migration, exile, or spiritual journey ending in death. o Ketu + Venus + Sun point to karmic exile and untimely severance. Age-Linked Possibility (Progression Insight) 🔹 Jupiter progression: • Jupiter rules Lagna and 10th. • By 10–12 years, Jupiter might enter or transit the 3rd, 4th or 8th house, activating Ketu–Venus–Sun. 🔹 Rahu/Ketu BCP: • Ketu in 2nd, possibly activating Rahu–Ketu axis, leading to fated foreign death or exit by karma. 🔹 BCP at Age 3 (3rd house activated): • Mars is in 3rd = activation of the 9th lord (father). • Combined with Ketu–Venus–Sun’s karmic setup, a paternal loss or foreign event could occur. Summary Table Feature Placement Lagna Pisces Sun (Pitrukaraka) 2nd house (Aries) With Venus (3rd & 8th lord), Ketu Mars (9th lord) 3rd house (Taurus) 9th house aspect Not directly affected Result One among three paternal males dies abroad. Karmic Note Foreign karma, death in a non-native place, caused by Ketu's severance & Venus' maraka role

TamilVerse: இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் தன, சுக, சப்தம, பாக்கியாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி, பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் கேதுயிருந்தால் தந்தை ஜாதகனுக்கு பதினைந்தில் மரணம், பிதாவால் கட்டிய மனை கட்டட முண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Pitrukaraka Sun is in the 2nd house (Aries). It is conjoined with: • Mars – lord of 2nd (Dhana) and 9th (Bhagya/paternal) houses. • Mercury – lord of 4th (Sukha) and 7th houses. Ketu is placed in the 9th house (house of father and dharma). • The native’s father dies when the native is 15 years old. • A building or house constructed by the father exists (a karmic material legacy). . Classical Astrological Interpretation Planet House (from Lagna) Role Meaning Sun 2nd (Aries) Pitrukaraka Father, lineage Mars 2nd (Aries) 2nd & 9th Lord Wealth & Father Mercury 2nd (Aries) 4th & 7th Lord Comfort, marriage Ketu 9th (Scorpio) Moksha, detachment, karmic finality Severance from paternal roots • Sun–Mars–Mercury in 2nd house: o This emphasises inheritance, wealth, and built property (Mercury = 4th lord, Mars = builder). o Father may be self-made, with strong karma in physical construction or land. • Ketu in 9th: o Cuts or severs ties with father, spiritualizes or isolates the paternal karma. o Indicates loss of father or loss of guidance around mid-teens. • 2nd house loaded with key lords shows that: o The father has contributed tangibly to the native’s life (house/property), o But karmically departs early due to Ketu's severance in the 9th. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun + Mars + Mercury = substantial karmic, material, and speech-related inheritance. • All three planets are functional benefics and significators of karma: o Mars (9th lord) symbolises father and also building karma (real estate). o Mercury (4th lord) indicates home, education, and assets. • The presence of Ketu in the 9th indicates: o Dissolution of the paternal physical presence. o But karmic residue remains, i.e., the house or construction lives on after the father’s death. Age 15 – Timing Insight BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) Activation: • Age 15 → 3rd house activated. • The 3rd house is Taurus, ruled by Venus (neutral to Sun). • No major planet is present there, but from Taurus: o Ketu (in 9th) is in the 7th house from 3rd → indicating severance from father. o Also, Mars as 9th lord aspects the 9th from its position in Aries. Karmic Symbolism of Property • The 4th lord Mercury with Mars in 2nd house = clear indication of: o A constructed home or asset left by the father. o House karma is transmitted to the native even after the father’s death. • This echoes the Nadi principle of "pitrukarma continues through Vastu (dwelling)". Summary Table Element Description Lagna Pisces Sun (Pitrukaraka) 2nd house (Aries) Conjoined Planets Mars (2nd & 9th lord), Mercury (4th & 7th lord) Ketu Placement 9th house (Scorpio) Result Father dies when the native is 15; father leaves behind a constructed house/building. Karmic Motif Death of a paternal figure with material continuation (house as legacy)

TamilVerse: இரண்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாயிருந்து பாக்கியத்திலிருக்கும் பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதியை உச்ச குருவால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் பிதா தனவான், தீர்க்காயுள் அனேக பூமிகளுடையவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun, the Pitrukaraka, is alone in the 2nd house (Aries). • The 9th lord Mars (significator of father) is placed in the 9th house (Scorpio) – its own sign. • Jupiter, exalted in Cancer (5th house), aspects the 9th house (Pitrusthana). • This indicates that the native's father is wealthy, long-lived, and possesses extensive land holdings or real estate assets. Traditional Astrological Interpretation Planet House (from Lagna) Role Implication Sun 2nd (Aries) Pitrukaraka Father’s physical presence and vitality Mars 9th (Scorpio) Lord of 2nd and 9th houses Own house → strength to paternal line, land Jupiter 5th (Cancer) Lord of 1st and 10th; exalted Dharma, prosperity, support from karma • Sun alone in the 2nd house shows: o Father is independent, self-earned, associated with wealth and speech karma. • Mars in 9th (own sign): o Signifies strong paternal lineage, karmic legacy, and land ownership. • Jupiter exalted in 5th and aspecting 9th: o Blessings of dharma and prosperity flowing to the father. o Longevity and wealth (dhana yoga) for the father through land, children or education. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun in the 2nd house (Aries – a fiery, movable sign) indicates fiery initiative and resource-building by the father. • Mars, as the 9th lord in its sign, symbolises unbroken paternal karma. • Jupiter exalted in the trine (5th house) aspecting 9th denotes: o Paternal karma is strongly tied to Vedic merit, teaching, landholding, and religious inclination. • This combination shows a father with dharmic strength, vast material base (land), and longevity (Satwik Mars + exalted Jupiter). Summary Table Element Description Lagna Pisces Sun (Pitrukaraka) Alone in the 2nd house (Aries) Mars In the 9th house (Scorpio – own sign) Jupiter Exalted in the 5th house (Cancer), aspects the 9th Result Father is wealthy, long-lived, and owns large tracts of land. Karmic Insight Strong paternal dharma and ancestral prosperity; enduring legacy Sun in 3rd house-Taurus மூன்றாமிடம்

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன், புந்தி, ராகுவுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை சகோதரம் ஆணிரண்டு, பெண்ணொன்று, கனிட்ட பிதா விர்த்தியில்லை. ஜாதகன் பிறந்த நான்கு வயது வரையில் உத்தியோக நஷ்டம், இருபத்தெட்டில் பிதுர் கர்மமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka (Sun) is in the 3rd house (Taurus) from Pisces Lagna. The Sun is conjoined with Mercury (Budh) and Rahu. The native’s father has two brothers and one sister. The youngest paternal sibling remains unestablished (no career or sustenance). The father experiences job loss by the time the native is 4 years old. The father dies when the native is 28 years old. Traditional Astrological Insights Planet Position Role / House Lordship Astrological Meaning Sun 3rd house (Taurus) Pitrukaraka Shows father's strength/placement Mercury 3rd house 4th & 7th lord Brings in matters of comfort and marital themes Rahu 3rd house Karaka for karma acceleration Amplifies karmic results 3rd house House of siblings, courage, and early karma - Reveals sibling structure and the father's early struggle • Sun + Mercury + Rahu in 3rd → Shows karmic entanglement of the father with siblings and effort-based karma. • The conjunction with Rahu brings distortion or sudden disruptions, often indicating career instability. • Mercury’s presence ties this to communication or service professions. • Rahu may also indicate foreign karmas or invisible karmic debts of the father. Sibling Analysis – Nadi Insight Based on earlier sibling observation, here's the integrated commentary: • Mars, being the karaka for siblings, is not directly placed in the 3rd, but aspects can be considered from Scorpio (9th). • Sun in a fixed, female sign (Taurus) + Mercury (neutral) + Rahu (masculine) suggests: o Two male siblings (Sun + Rahu’s masculine energy). o One female sibling (influence of Taurus + Mercury). • The youngest sibling remains unsettled or unstable (due to Rahu's malefic placement). • Mercury and Rahu may cause paternal sibling rivalry, confusion, or career drift. Timing Logic – BCP & Nadi Progression Event: Job Loss (Age 4) • At age 4, the 4th house (Gemini) is activated (BCP). • Lord Mercury, placed in the 3rd, brings: o Fluctuations in job or income (as Mercury is the lord of comfort and employment). o Mercury-Rahu in 3rd adds disruption. Father’s Death (Age 28) • Age 28 activates the 4th from the 9th (i.e., 12th house from the father), which is the house of exit/loss for the father. • This aligns with maraka logic for the father. • If we take the native at the age of 28, his 4th house is activated, 4th lord Mercury is the 2nd lord of maraka from the Sun. From the 9th house, the 4th house is the 8th house of longevity, and its lord is placed with the Sun in the 7th house from the 9th house. Alternate progression: • Jupiter may be in its third cycle, reaching an angular or maraka position from the 9th. • Saturn might have returned to a key transit or aspecting the 9th or 2nd from the Sun. Summary Table Element Description Lagna Pisces Pitrukaraka (Sun) 3rd house (Taurus) Conjunctions Mercury (4th & 7th lord), Rahu Siblings Two brothers, one sister; youngest unsettled Early karma Father loses his job at the age of 4 native. Father’s death Occurs at the native's age 28 Karmic theme Father’s life marked by struggle, disrupted sustenance due to Rahu-Mercury conjunction.

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன், ஏகனாய் நின்று, ஆறிலிருக்கும் லாப விரையாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப்பட்டு பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் பஞ்சமாதிபன் நீச்சமடைந்தால் தந்தையுடன் ஆணிரண்டு, பெண்ணிரண்டு, நாற்பது நாளில் பிதுர் கர்மமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Pitrukaraka Sun is alone in the 3rd house (Taurus). Saturn, lord of the 11th (gains) and 12th (losses), is placed in the 6th house and aspects the Sun. Moon, lord of the 5th house, is debilitated in the 9th house (Scorpio). • The father has two male and two female children (native included). • The father dies 40 days after the birth of the native. Traditional & Nadi Astrology Insight: Sun in 3rd House (Taurus): • Sun in a female, fixed sign (Taurus) = karmic rigidity, especially concerning siblings. • Being alone here adds to the idea of the isolation of paternal karma. Saturn (6th house – Leo): • Saturn’s aspect (10th) on Sun creates Pitrudosha, which is particularly strong when: o Saturn is the 12th lord (loss/separation). o The aspect falls on Sun (karaka for father). • The 6th house is rogasthana, and Saturn brings chronic karmic affliction. Moon in 9th House (Scorpio): • Moon is debilitated and rules the 5th house (children). • Moon in 9th = weak support to paternal lineage. • Shows a broken karmic link through maternal-afflicted dharma. • From the 9th, Moon aspects the 3rd house, again reflecting disrupted family harmony. Sibling Analysis: • The 3rd lord from the Sun is the Moon and will give a female sibling. • Moon placed in a female sign and aspecting Sun again placed in a female sign indicates another female sibling. • The 3rd lord from the 9th house is Saturn. Saturn is placed in a male sign. Hence, one male sibling. • Saturn aspects the Sun, bringing one more male because of the male influence of the Sun. Timing Logic: Death of Father in 40 Days: • From the Lagna, the 3rd house (Sun) activates short-term karmic outcomes. • Saturn’s drishti (aspect) causes immediate karmic detachment from the paternal figure. • Moon (debilitated) in the 9th implies weak prarabdha karma of the father. • The 12th lord, Saturn, casting aspect on Sun in the 3rd (house of efforts/survival) seals this early death possibility. Nadi texts often mention Nazhikai-based timing (1.6 hrs per day = accelerated karmic unfolding). This supports such short timelines as 40 days for major events like a father’s death. Summary Table Element Placement Effect Sun (Pitrukaraka) 3rd house (Taurus), alone Indicates the isolated karmic burden of the father Saturn (12th/11th Lord) 6th house, aspects Sun (10th drishti) Indicates karmic separation and fatality Moon (5th Lord) 9th house (Scorpio), debilitated Weak support for paternal karma, siblings Sibling Count 2 male + 2 female siblings Indicated by Sun and Moon placements Father’s Death At 40 days of the native’s age Based on Saturn-Moon-Sun interaction

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன், தன சுக, சப்தம, பாக்கியாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்க மூன்றிலொருவன் ஜல யாத்திரையில் மரணம். பிதா வேதாந்தி, தீர்த்த யாத்திரை யுடையவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 3rd house (Taurus). • It is conjoined with: o Mars – lord of 2nd (Dhana/Wealth) and 9th (Bhagya/Father) o Mercury – lord of 4th (Sukha/Mother) and 7th (Spouse) • This configuration signifies: o Among the three paternal male lineages (siblings), one dies during a water pilgrimage. o The father is spiritually inclined (Vedantin) and engages in pilgrimages to sacred waters (Theertha Yatra). Traditional & Nadi Insight: Sun in 3rd House: • Sun here reflects a karmic continuity of ancestral duties and rites. • Its conjunction with multiple Kendra and Trikona lords points to diverse dharmic obligations. Mars – 9th Lord in 3rd: • Mars as the 9th lord of the father in the 3rd = active, mobile karma related to paternal duties, communication, or travels. • Mars governs pilgrimage when connected to the 3rd house (movement) and water element signs or karakas. Mercury – 4th and 7th Lord: • Mercury represents intellect, discourse, and Vedantic inquiry. • Its presence alongside Sun and Mars reflects spiritual talk, Vedic knowledge, and travel narratives. Jala Yatra & Paternal Siblings: • The 3rd house signifies siblings and journeys. • The mention of "three paternal lineages" implies the father has two brothers; out of the three, one meets his end during a water pilgrimage. o The "Jala yatra" (sacred water journey) represents both spiritual cleansing and karmic release. o This could also be symbolic of death during a transit or pilgrimage, especially near sacred rivers or seas. Saturn’s Possible Role (Implied): • If Saturn aspects or is involved, it may reinforce the karmic inevitability of the sibling's death via spiritual immersion. Father’s Nature (Vedantin): • Mars + Sun + Mercury = intense karma, pursuit of philosophy, and spiritual austerity. • This reflects the father as: o A Vedantin – one who pursues Jnana Yoga (path of wisdom) o A Theertha yatri – undertaking sacred journeys, symbolic of renunciation or final karmic purification. Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 3rd house (Taurus) Karma through paternal journeys Mars (2nd & 9th lord) With Sun, in 3rd Paternal karma, siblings, sacred journey Mercury (4th & 7th lord) With Sun and Mars Vedantic tendencies, discourses, travel Siblings (Paternal) 3 males total → 1 dies during Jala yatra Based on 3rd house and Mars involvement Father’s Path Vedanta and Theertha Yatra Strong spiritual lifestyle

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன், சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதி நீச்சமடைந்திருந்தால், தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் மூன்றில் தந்தை ஞானியாயும், சோதிட சாஸ்திரியாயும், யோகவானாயும், தீர்க்கவானாயுமிருப்பனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Pitrukaraka Sun is in the 3rd house (Taurus). • Conjoined with Mercury, lord of the 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalatra) houses. • Mars, the 9th lord (house of father), is debilitated in the 5th house (Cancer). • Among three male members of the paternal lineage, the father is: o A scholar o An astrologer o A fortunate individual o A person of long life (Deerghayu) Astrological Interpretation Sun in 3rd House (Taurus): • Sun here denotes effortful karma connected with writing, speech, and knowledge—a perfect base for a Jyotisha (astrological) scholar. • 3rd house rules communication, manuscripts, and advisory skills, all necessary for shastra vidya. Mercury’s Role: • Mercury, the 4th and 7th lord, indicates education, intellect, comfort, and interaction. • Its conjunction with the Sun enhances analytical ability and interpretation of knowledge, especially if connected with ancient scriptures (like Jyotisha shastra). • The Mercury–Sun conjunction forms Buddha Aditya Yoga (though Mercury is combust, it retains intellect in Taurus). Mars (9th Lord) in 5th House (Debilitated): • Though Mars is debilitated in Cancer, it occupies the 5th house, the seat of mantra, knowledge, and memory. • As the 9th lord in a trikona, even in debility, it connects the father’s destiny with vidya (education). • Mars in the 5th from Lagna throws its 4th aspect to the 8th house (research/esoteric) – linking the father with occult wisdom. Paternal Lineage Insight: • The "three males in the paternal line" indicates the father has two male siblings. • Among them, the father stands out due to: o Jnana (Wisdom) → indicated by the Sun–Mercury in 3rd. o Jyotisha shastra expertise → 3rd house + Mercury + 5th house Mars. o Yoga (fortune/discipline) → Mars in 5th relates to Yoga both spiritually and physically. o Deerghayu (Long life) → Longevity suggested despite Mars' debility, due to favourable trikona placement and supporting houses. BCP/Nadi Progression Insight (Timing of Father’s Legacy): • At age 9 (activating the 9th house), debilitated Mars (9th lord) in the 5th could show early signs of the father’s spiritual wisdom influencing the native. • At age 5, the 5th house is activated—a time when father's intellectual or spiritual influence might manifest. • Despite debility, Mars in the 5th activates karmic patterns of learning and teaching. Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 3rd house (Taurus) Wisdom lineage, karma through effort Mercury (4th & 7th lord) With Sun in 3rd Learning, writing, discourse, astrology Mars (9th lord) 5th house (Cancer, debilitated) Fortune, intellect, despite challenges, long life Father’s Role Scholar, astrologer, spiritually inclined, long-lived Siblings (Father’s Line) 3 total males, father being spiritually advanced

TamilVerse: மூன்றாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன், சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதியான குஜன் ஞானகாரகனுடன் சப்தம கேந்திரம் பெற்றிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகன், வர்த்தக மூலம் உபாய ஜீவனம் செய்வனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • The Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 3rd house (Taurus). • It is conjoined with Mercury, lord of the 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalatra) houses. • The 9th lord Mars (significator of father and dharma) is in the 7th house, conjoined with Rahu, a Gyana karaka (significator of knowledge or unconventional intelligence). • The father is a solitary individual (no siblings or estranged). • He earns his livelihood through trade or business, employing unconventional or clever strategies. Astrological Interpretation Sun in 3rd House (Taurus): • Represents the father's karmic path involving communication, enterprise, courage, and possibly short travels. • The 3rd house, being an Upachaya (growth) house, shows effort-based sustenance. • Placement here indicates the father is self-made and dependent on his skills or trade acumen. Mercury's Influence: • Mercury, as lord of the 4th (comforts) and 7th (public, commerce) houses, represents both intellectual skill and negotiation ability. • Its conjunction with the Sun (forming Buddha Aditya Yoga) strengthens the analytical and business faculties of the father. Mars (9th Lord) in 7th House with Rahu: • Mars, lord of the 9th house (father), placed in the 7th house (Kalatra, partnerships), indicates a public-facing or commerce-oriented father. • Rahu, being the Gyana karaka, adds a clever, unorthodox dimension to the father's thinking. • This combination favours import/export, brokerage, or tactful negotiation. Paternal Lineage Insight: • The verse notes "தந்தை ஏகன்" – father is solitary, indicating: o No siblings or karmically detached from lineage. o Could be the only surviving male in his family. • His livelihood is strategy-based, relying on wit, knowledge, and adaptability (Mercury-Rahu themes). • Though Mars, the karaka for siblings, is placed in the 11th house from the 9th house, there are no siblings due to the presence of Rahu. Progression Analysis (BCP / Nadi style) • 3rd house activation (Sun + Mercury) → Early in life (age 3): the father's influence is tied to enterprise/communication. • 7th house activation (~ age 7) → Mars-Rahu conjunction: Father’s work or trade becomes more visible to the native or transforms. • 9th house activation (age 9) → Mars as lord: karmic themes related to father's dharma and livelihood choices may begin manifesting. If the age of death or life shifts are tracked by Rahu progression, Rahu in the 7th may cause: • Major career shift or foreign/clever trade associations for father. • Solitary path (no assistance) but survival via adaptability. Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 3rd house (Taurus) Father's karma through effort, trade Mercury (4th & 7th lord) With Sun in 3rd Intelligence, business skills, negotiation Mars (9th lord) 7th house (Virgo) Father tied to partnerships, commerce Rahu (Gyana karaka) With Mars in 7th Clever business, solitary success Father Alone, business-minded, succeeds through trade and tact. Sun in 4th house-Gemini நான்காமிடம்

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாயிருந்து பிதுர் ஸ்தானம் பற்றிய லாப விரையாதிபதியை ரோக ஸ்தானமேறிய தன பாக்கியாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டால் தந்தையுடன் பெண்ணேகம், தீர்க்கமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is alone in the 4th house (Gemini). Saturn, lord of the 11th (gains) and 12th (loss/separation), is placed in the 9th house (house of father – Scorpio). Mars, lord of the 2nd (family) and 9th (father), is placed in the 6th house (Leo), from where it aspects Saturn. This configuration results in: • The father has one female companion (interpreted as one daughter or a female sibling in the household). • The father is long-lived (தீர்க்கம்). Astrological Insight Sun in 4th House (Gemini): • The Sun alone in the 4th house shows the father's identity is tied to the domestic sphere — home, property, or emotional grounding. • Absence of planetary conjunction gives independent expression to the pitrukaraka. Saturn in 9th House (Scorpio): • Saturn owns the 11th (ambitions, legacy) and 12th (liberation, loss). • Its placement in the 9th indicates a paternal figure tied to karma, detachment, and endurance. • Saturn is not strong in Scorpio, a Mars sign — suggesting serious, disciplined dharmic karma, possibly late fulfilment. Mars in 6th House (Leo): • Mars, as the 9th lord, placed in the 6th, represents karmic struggle related to the father, effort, and service. • Mars aspects Saturn (its sign Scorpio), bringing activation and drive to the paternal lineage. • Mars, also being the 2nd lord, connects family and livelihood with the paternal storyline. Family Indication: • "தந்தையுடன் பெண்ணேகம்" – indicates one prominent female member alongside the father — may be: o A daughter (native’s sister), o Or a female sibling of the father, o Or possibly the only daughter of the father, if no sons are implied. • The lack of other siblings in the verse suggests a narrow paternal family unit. • Mars, the karaka for siblings, is placed in a male sign and a friendly sign. It is in the 3rd from the Sun. As such, a male sibling should be there. But why a female sibling? • Saturn is also another sibling karaka, being the lord of the 3rd house from the 9th house. Saturn is dual. Saturn is placed in a female sign. Its aspect on Mars gives one female sibling restricting it further/ Karmic Timelines (BCP/Nadi Insight): Age House Activated Key Event ~4 4th house Sun activates father’s connection to home ~6 6th house Mars is active – karmic duties, stress; aspect to Saturn begins activation. ~9 9th house Saturn activated – father’s karma ripens, possible maturity of dharmic role. • The aspect of Mars to Saturn shows a karma of longevity and continued effort. • Saturn’s role ensures long life to the father despite hurdles (Saturn in Scorpio). Summary Table Element Position Role in Verse Sun (Pitrukaraka) 4th house (Gemini), alone Focused paternal karma is linked to the home Saturn (11th & 12th lord) 9th house (Scorpio) Denotes long-lived, serious father Mars (2nd & 9th lord) 6th house (Leo), aspects Saturn Activates paternal karma through struggle Result 1 female companion; Father long-lived Per verse

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய சுக சப்தம அஷ்டமாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி களத்திர ஸ்தானமேறிய லாப விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தையுடன் ஆண் நான்கு, பெண்ணொன்று, ஜாதகன் வருட மூன்றில் மரணமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is in the 4th house (Gemini) conjoined with: • Mercury (3rd and 7th lord – siblings & marriage), • Venus (8th and 3rd lord – longevity & siblings). Saturn, the 11th (gains) and 12th (loss) lord, is placed in the 7th house (Virgo), aspecting this trio in the 4th. • The father is accompanied by four males (sons or siblings) and one female. • The native dies in the 3rd year of life. Astrological Interpretation Sun, Mercury & Venus in the 4th House (Gemini): • Sun in the 4th house represents a father oriented toward home, roots, emotional base, possibly performing duties silently within the family. • Mercury (3rd/7th lord): male siblings, marital themes, speech and intellect — together with Venus, a rich karmic script forms around relationships and house-related karma. • Venus (8th lord): Its association with longevity and transformation shows a karmic disturbance. • Venus and Mercury as dual lords of siblings and the 8th house bring in themes of family cluster and early maraka potential. Saturn in the 7th House (Virgo): • Saturn aspects the 4th house — influencing Sun-Mercury-Venus. • Saturn as lord of 11th and 12th shows gain-loss polarity, and its 10th aspect onto this trio indicates: o Blocked support systems (Saturn = delay, restriction), o Early karmic culmination indicated by the 12th lord’s role and the 4th house (mother/home/heart). Nadi Interpretation: • “ஆண் நான்கு, பெண்ணொன்று”: Father’s lineage includes four males and one female, likely siblings of the father or shared paternal offspring. • A combination of Mercury & Venus in a dual sign (Gemini) increases the count of siblings/companions. • Saturn’s aspect to this group triggers separation or detachment early in the native’s life. • Saturn, being the karaka for siblings because of the 3rd lordship from the 9th house, gives another sibling, which will be a female, as Saturn is dual and is placed in a female sign. Timing of Death (Year 3): Nadi Age Progression / Planetary Cycles: Age House Activated Key Planet Reason 3 3rd house Mercury 3rd lord involved with 8th lord Venus and aspected by 12th lord Saturn → maraka activation. 3 8th house link Venus Brings death potential through its association with Mercury and the Sun 3 Saturnian aspect — Saturn, lord of loss, aspects the Lagna lord and Pitrukaraka cluster, completing the karmic script This aligns with early death in the 3rd year, due to karmic pressure from multiple maraka agents (Saturn, Venus, Mercury in critical houses). As per BCP, in the 3rd year, the 3rd house is activated. The third house is the 12th house of exit from the Sun and the 7th house of maraka from the 9th house of the father. 3rd lord, Venus, is the Sun, indicating the death of the father. Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 4th house (Gemini) Father is involved in domestic/family karmas Mercury (3rd & 7th lord) 4th house with Sun Siblings/marriage karma and early life intellect Venus (8th & 3rd lord) 4th house with Sun & Mercury Longevity and sibling-linked karmic cut-off Saturn (11th & 12th lord) 7th house (Virgo), aspects 4th house Delayed support, karmic culmination Result 4 males + 1 female; native dies in year 3 Matching verse prediction

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி, பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் நீச்சனிருந்தால் ஜாதகன் பிறந்த பின்பு பிதுர், மாதுர் விரோதமுண்டாகி அம்மான் வீட்டில் வளர்வனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Pitrukaraka Sun is in the 4th house (Gemini), conjoined with Mercury, the lord of the 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalatra). Moon, representing the 5th house (intelligence) and also motherly nurturing, is debilitated in Scorpio, the 9th house (father). Following the native’s birth, a conflict develops between the parents, resulting in the native being raised by the maternal uncle. Astrological Interpretation Sun & Mercury in the 4th House (Gemini): • The Sun, placed in the 4th, shows the father influencing the home and emotional base of the native. • Mercury, as lord of 4th (home/comfort) and 7th (marriage/relationships), combines intellect with relational energy, but also potential for domestic misunderstandings, especially in dual sign Gemini. • When Sun and Mercury are conjunct, they create Budha Aditya Yoga – but in Gemini and this context, it reflects mental and verbal friction in the household setup. Moon Debilitated in the 9th (Scorpio): • Moon as mother, placed in the house of father (9th) and debilitated, indicates: o Emotional disruption in father-mother dynamics. o Lack of nurturing from the mother in connection with the father's dharmic path. • It also weakens the mother’s emotional strength, leading to estrangement or separation. Nadi Interpretation: • The father (Sun) and mother (Moon) are symbolically placed in a conflict axis (4th and 9th house). • Mercury, as 7th lord, in the 4th with Sun may signify marital disputes. • Resultant Karmic Outcome: The native does not grow in his biological home, but instead under maternal care, specifically in the maternal uncle’s home (அம்மான் வீடு) – a common Nadi idiom for mother’s brother’s house. Timing Consideration: • While this verse doesn't mention a specific age, it strongly implies early separation, possibly within infancy or toddlerhood, since it's tied to post-birth domestic fallout. • The presence of Moon (debilitated) suggests: o First 1–2 years of life see key transitions in the domestic setting. • Mercury and Moon both relate to early childhood phases and sensory development – disruption here points to emotional detachment early in life. Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 4th house (Gemini) Father’s karmic connection with the domestic setting Mercury (4th & 7th lord) 4th house with Sun Marital discord, verbal friction Moon (mother) 9th house (Scorpio), debilitated Emotional disruption, loss of marital harmony Result Native raised in maternal uncle’s home due to parental discord.

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் புதன், சுக்கிரனுடன் கூடி பிதுர்ஸ்தான மேறிய பஞ்சம, லாப, விரையாதிபதிகளால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால், தந்தையுடன் பெண்ணிரண்டு, விர்த்தியில்லை. முப்பதுக்குமேல் பிதுர் கண்டம், ரோகாதிபன் திசையில் ஜாதகன் பரதேசியாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is conjoined with Mercury (4th & 7th lord) and Venus (3rd & 8th lord) in the 4th house (Gemini). The 9th house (Scorpio) is occupied by Saturn and Moon, who are the lords of the 11th & and 12th 5th respectively. Effects: • Father is accompanied by two female siblings, all without professional progress. • After age 30, the father enters a difficult phase (கண்டம்). • In the dasa of the 6th lord, the native moves abroad. Astrological Interpretation Sun + Mercury + Venus in the 4th House (Gemini): • A classic Budha-Aditya Yoga combined with Venus suggests: o Intelligence and refinement within the household. o But also a possibility of luxury without productivity – especially when Venus (8th lord) is involved. • The 4th house is the emotional and domestic seat. With all three in Gemini (a dual, air sign), the home lacks grounding, indicating instability. Saturn + Moon in the 9th House (Scorpio): • Saturn (11th & 12th lord) and Moon (5th lord) in Scorpio, a fixed water sign, show psychological burden, loss of paternal dharma, and obstruction in family karma. • The Moon is not only the karaka for mother, but as the 5th lord, its placement here shows struggles in legacy, children, and support. • Saturn, as lord of 12th and placed in 9th, heavily restrains paternal fortune. Nadi Insights: Father's Family & Karma: • The father has two female companions or sisters, but they all face stagnation in career/livelihood ("விர்த்தியில்லை"). • Two female siblings, because of Saturn, in conjunction with the Moon and placement in a female sign. • Venus conjoined with the Sun sometimes indicates dependency or emotional entanglement rather than material gain. Kandam after Age 30: • "கண்டம்" is a critical karmic period that often involves health deterioration or sudden loss. • The triggering time at 30+ years aligns with Saturn return or maturity of Venus – both timing devices in Nadi. Foreign Travel during 6th Lord Dasa: • The 6th lord is Jupiter, placed either in the 5th or 6th house (depending on chart). • As the 6th lord, it signifies conflict, legal, or karmic debts. • Its dasa leading to foreign settlement (பரதேசி) aligns with Nadi trends – especially when the 12th lord (Saturn) is in the 9th house. Timing Logic: • 30+ years → father’s critical karmic shift • Dasa of 6th lord Jupiter → major relocation for native • These periods may also correlate with: o Jupiter in BCP progression reaching Lagna or 12th house o Saturn transit over 4th or 9th axis, triggering domestic-paternal shifts Summary Table Element Placement Interpretation Sun (Pitrukaraka) 4th house (Gemini) with Mercury & Venus Father + siblings without prosperity Mercury (4th & 7th lord) 4th house Domestic confusion, marital tension Venus (3rd & 8th lord) 4th house Financial and karmic stagnation Saturn (11th & 12th lord) 9th house (Scorpio) Paternal legacy weakened Moon (5th lord) 9th house Emotional severance from dharma Key Outcomes Father with two females, no progress; father’s downfall after 30; foreign travel during Jupiter dasa

TamilVerse: நான்காமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகனுடன் சந்திரன், புதன், சுக்கிரனிவர் மூவர் கூடி, பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை சத்துரு ஸ்தானமேறிய தன பாகியாதியால் நோக்கப்பட்டால், தந்தையுடன் ஆண் மூன்று, பெண்ணொன்று. இருபத்திரண்டில் பிதுர் கர்மம், பிதுர்கள் தேசமாறி ஜீவிப்பரென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 4th house (Gemini) along with: o Moon (5th lord), o Mercury (4th and 7th lord), o Venus (3rd and 8th lord). • The 9th house (Scorpio), home of the father, is aspected by Mars (2nd and 9th lord), who is placed in the 6th house (Leo), a dusthana (malefic house). • There will be three male and one female sibling for the father. At the age of 22 of the native father will die. Siblings will be living in various countries. Astrological Interpretation Sun + Moon + Mercury + Venus in the 4th House (Gemini): • The conjunction of four planets in the 4th house represents a karmically active and turbulent domestic environment, full of learning, conflict, and emotional fluctuation. • Moon here amplifies maternal influence, but in the father’s context, it emphasises psychic disturbance and early loss. • Mercury and Venus suggest communication, comforts, and aesthetics, but also duplication of karmas (siblings or dual marriages in family lines). 9th House Aspected by Mars from the 6th House (Leo): • Mars, being both the 2nd lord (Maraka from 9th) and the 9th lord, represents the father’s karma and death potential. • From the 6th house, Mars aspects the 9th house, indicating: o Struggles for the father (legal, health, debt). o Eventual loss (Maraka influence). Siblings and Paternal Profile • With four planets (including Venus – female significator and Moon – emotional lineage), the siblings of the father are described as: o 3 males + 1 female, including the father. o Mars karaka for sibling placed in the 3rd house for the Sun. Mercury, the 11th lord from the 9th house, is with Sun and three planets, of which two are female. The conjunctions take place in a female sign. The combined influences of all these factors result in 3 males and one female. • The father himself is destined to pass away at the age of 22 for the native. • The verse notes the paternal lineage relocates abroad or to distant places (“தேசமாறி ஜீவிப்பர் • ”). Nadi Insights & Symbolism • The 4th house is the foundation – and its crowding here reflects the intensity of the karmic past linked to family, father’s relocation, and emotional conditioning. • The Moon, as mind and maternal karma, placed here, when associated with the Sun, can signify emotional estrangement from the father. • Venus (karaka of comforts) becomes the 8th lord, suggesting transitory joy or inheritance from the father, often following his passing. Timing Logic Father’s Death at 22 Years of Native: • Mars, as 2nd lord from 9th (Maraka), transiting or progressing to Lagna or 9th house could signify karmic culmination. • BCP/Nadi Age Progression: o At 22, the progression would place Jupiter/Mars possibly in sensitive positions like 8th from 9th. o At 22nd house, the 10th house is activated. The 10th house is the 7th house of maraka from the Sun. The 1oth house is also the 2nd house of maraka from the 9th house. Four planets aspecting this 10th house trigger the death of the father, • Alternatively, Rahu or Saturn progression can also trigger death at 22 due to their separative nature. TamilVerse: ஐந்தாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியான குரு ராகுவுடன் பிதுர் ஸ்தானமேறியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆணிரண்டு, ஜெனன காலம் கஷ்டம், பிதா மறைபடுவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 5th house (Leo) along with Mercury (lord of 4th and 7th). Jupiter (Ascendant and 10th lord) and Rahu are placed in the 9th house (Scorpio). Two male siblings. The native experiences hardship at birth, and the father is said to vanish or disappear mysteriously (marai paduthal). Pitrukaraka Placement • The Sun is firmly placed in Leo, its sign, which gives it directional strength and dignity. • Conjoined with Mercury, this creates a Buddha Aditya Yoga, often indicative of intellectualism and father’s communication/skillset. • The Sun being in the 5th house, a trine from the Lagna, enhances past life karma and ancestral patterns. House Occupations & Lords • 5th house occupied by Sun and Mercury – deals with Purva punya, children, and karmic legacies. • 9th house (house of father) is occupied by Jupiter (Ascendant & 10th lord) and Rahu – a significant placement since the 9th house denotes father, dharma, and spiritual luck. • Jupiter is not strong in Scorpio, and Rahu's presence may cause separation, confusion, or loss related to the father. Traditional Astrology Insight • Jupiter, the Lagna lord and natural significator of father, is afflicted by Rahu, indicating a disruption or unexpected events regarding fatherly presence. • Mercury, being the 4th and 7th lord, conjoined with the Sun in the 5th house, shows internalised domestic strife, possibly relating to the early home environment or marriage-related karmas of the father. • Rahu in the 9th house often signifies a non-conventional father, or estranged relationship, especially with affliction to Jupiter. Nadi Principle Insight • The combination of Pitrukaraka Sun with Mercury in the 5th, a dharma trikona, suggests karmic obligations inherited from the father, especially tied to education, children, or lineage sustenance. • Jupiter-Rahu in the 9th indicates a karmic split or break in the paternal lineage, perhaps due to foreign travel, spiritual withdrawal, or abandonment. • Nadi traditions consider Rahu in the 9th house a potent disruptor of paternal blessings, especially when no benefic aspect stabilises the house. Lineage/Siblings Analysis • Mars aspects the 9th house from 6th (if placed), or Mars in a dual sign implies two male siblings. • Sun as pitrukaraka + dual house occupation indicates a father with limited involvement in family due to displacement or karmic isolation. • The two male siblings are likely from the father’s side, inferred from Mars’s aspect and house lordship. Timing of Events (BCP/Nadi Age Progression) • At birth, Jupiter (the Lagna and 10th lord) is afflicted – signifying early instability. • Jupiter, as the 2nd lord from the 9th house, becomes a maraka for the father, and its placement in the 9th house is symbolically heavy for separation. • Progression logic: If Jupiter moves to the 12th from 9th (loss of father), or aspects the 8th house from Lagna, the event of father’s disappearance fits the early childhood phase. • Rahu’s progression through trinal or kendra houses may accelerate this karmic culmination.

TamilVerse: ஐந்தாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய பஞ்சம அஷ்டமாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி பாக்கியமேறிய இரவி புதல்வனை, தன பாக்கியாதிபதியால் நேரே பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தைக்குத் தாரமிரண்டு, இளமையில் மரணமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is conjoined in the 5th house (Cancer) with Moon (5th lord) and Venus (3rd and 8th lord). Mars (9th and 2nd lord) is placed in the 3rd house (Taurus), and Saturn is placed in the 9th house directly. This configuration results in the father having two wives and an early death. Pitrukaraka Placement • The Sun, conjoined with Moon and Venus, sits in the 5th house, a trine, suggesting karmic memory and legacy. • Moon, being the 5th lord, reinforces the strength of the 5th house, but Venus, being the 8th lord, injects a volatile undercurrent — one of loss, transformation, and sudden ends. • This combination reflects a karmic entanglement relating to progeny, dharma, and paternal line. Key Planetary Dynamics • Mars, the 9th lord (father) and 2nd lord (maraka to father), is in the 3rd house, aspecting the 9th house (Scorpio) — a direct maraka influence on paternal matters. • Saturn, a slow-moving karmic graha, is placed directly in the 9th house, adding weight, delay, and sorrow to father-related matters. • Saturn as 12th lord (loss/separation) in the 9th house explicitly correlates with loss of father, often in youth. Traditional Astrology Insight • Father with two wives is inferred from: o Sun (karaka for father) conjoined with Venus (karaka for spouse). o Venus is also the 8th lord — hidden affairs or second marriage scenario. • Early death arises from: o Venus (8th lord) with Sun, o Mars (maraka from 9th) aspecting 9th, o Saturn (12th lord) sitting in the 9th — combining loss, longevity cut, and karmic closure. Nadi Principle Insight • Heavy occupation of the 5th house suggests strong paternal karma, especially relating to legacy and continuity. • Presence of 8th lord Venus with Sun and 12th lord Saturn in 9th, both point toward past-life debts culminating in this birth via father's short lifespan. • The placement of Sun (karaka for father) in a sign of emotion (Cancer), along with Venus and Moon, shows an affectionate yet fragile paternal connection. BCP / Nadi Age Progression & Timing • Mars, as 9th lord and maraka, aspecting the 9th house, can trigger early death when: o Progressed Jupiter or Saturn aspects/conjuncts Venus or the 8th house. o During Saturn or Venus dasa, with transit to 9th or 8th from 9th. • Saturn (12th lord) in 9th activates loss of father during: o Saturn Mahadasha (or Antar Dasha), o Or when Saturn progresses over natal Moon/Venus. Summary of Effects Factor Result Father’s marital life Two wives, due to Venus + Sun Father’s death Early, due to Venus (8th) + Saturn (12th lord) + Mars aspect Emotional tone Heavy karmic memory around paternal life Sibling indicators Strong emotional role in family, some may represent past life connections. Native’s experience Early emotional disconnection from father, possible spiritual orientation due to 5th house emphasis

TamilVerse: ஐந்தாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் நீச்சனுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் நிலைப்பு ஆணிரண்டு. வர்க்கம் செல்வமுண்டாம். தந்தைக்கு சிரசில் ரோகம். புத்திர தோஷமுண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 5th house to the Pisces Lagna native and is conjoined with the debilitated Mars. In the father’s lineage, there will be two male members. Lineage will be wealthy. Father will have a disease in the head. There is Putra Dosha. Pitrukaraka Placement (Sun in Cancer) • Sun placed in Cancer, a water sign governed by Moon, indicates emotional connection to father. • The 5th house represents children, legacy, karmic lineage, and with the Sun here, paternal karma is emphasised. • The presence of Mars (debilitated) in the same house introduces conflict, aggression, and weakness — particularly symbolic of physical ailments and legacy disruption. Mars Debilitation – Traditional Interpretation • Debilitated Mars (Cancer) is linked to: o Weak willpower, aggression issues o Health vulnerabilities, especially head-related, when conjoined with the Sun. o As Mars rules blood and muscles, affliction may point to neurological or cranial issues. • Sun + Mars also indicates Pitta-related imbalances or hypertension in traditional Ayurveda-based astrology. Lineage & Siblings Analysis • The verse mentions two male members in the paternal lineage. • This is supported astrologically by: o Mars (karaka for brothers/siblings) is placed in a dual sign’s trine (Cancer), doubling the effect. o Mars in debilitation shows a limited but stable presence – perhaps two brothers, but with challenges. • The phrase “வர்க்கம் நிலைப்பு ” points to stability in family lineage, even if lean in numbers. Wealth & Stability • Despite debilitated Mars, the overall outcome indicates wealth: o Sun in the 5th house often confers inheritance and family wealth. o Mars is the 2nd lord (house of wealth) and 9th lord (fortune) — even when debilitated, its placement with Sun strengthens the karmic financial base. o The lineage will have wealth despite possible interpersonal struggles or emotional strain. Putra Dosha (Progeny Affliction) • “புத்திர தோஷம்” implies: o Difficulties with childbirth, loss of children, or karmic block in having male children. • Astrologically: o The 5th house governs children and legacy. o Its affliction by Mars (8th aspect from debilitation) + combust condition with Sun shows obstruction in progeny-related matters. o It may manifest as: • Delay in childbirth • Loss or emotional distance from children • Break in legacy/lineage Nadi Principle Insight • The conjunction of Sun (father) + Mars (aggression/karma) in 5th reflects a powerful karmic echo: o The father’s mental/emotional or physical health is affected (Mars rules head in Kalapurusha). o Mars, as the 9th lord being debilitated, also suggests weakened paternal blessings or early difficulties from the father. Age-wise Activation (BCP or Nadi Progression) • In BCP (Bhrighu Chakra Paddhati): o 5th year → activation of the 5th house: Sun + Mars = possible significant childhood event, especially regarding the father or health. • Mars, being a natural maraka and debilitated, could signify: o Critical health concern around age 28 or age 36 (Mars cycles). o Father’s head illness may aggravate during Mars Dasa or Antardasa or when transit Mars aspects the 5th house. Summary Table Astrological Factor Interpretation Sun in the 5th house Strong karmic connection to legacy, but emotional strain Mars (debilitated) with Sun Father has head disease, possibility of aggressive temperament Lineage members Two males, stable lineage but small in number Wealth status Stable and sufficient, despite karmic obstacles Putra Dosha Difficulties in childbearing or lineage continuation Timing activation Mars/Sun periods, 5th year, Mars progression years

TamilVerse: ஐந்தாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஞானகாரகனுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபதியான குஜன் சப்தம கேந்திரத்தில் உபைய மந்திரிகளுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகம், பூமி, செல்வம், பலமான கட்டட முண்டாம். ஜாதகனுக்குப் பதினொன்றில் பிதுர் கர்மமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In the fifth house to Pisces Lagna, pitrukaraka Sun is conjoined with Gnana Karaka Rahu, and the 9th lord Mars is placed in the 7th house with the two ministers, Mercury and Venus. Father will be alone; there will be lands, wealth and strong buildings. The native has to perform the final rites for the father at 11th age. Pitrukaraka Placement (Sun + Rahu in Cancer) • Sun in Cancer, a soft, emotional, and maternal sign, reflects deep karmic attachment to father and legacy. • Rahu, when placed with Sun, often obscures or complicates paternal matters, indicating: o A complex karmic bond with the father o Possible early absence, mystery, or illusion surrounding the father o A destined responsibility to carry forward the ancestral karma 9th Lord Mars in 7th with Mercury and Venus • Mars is the 9th lord (father, dharma) and 2nd lord (family, wealth). • Mars in Virgo shows a calculative, land-focused, managerial nature — real estate, land transactions, and administration. • With Mercury and Venus, called Upaya Mantri Karas (advisors), this placement signifies: o Skill-based wealth accumulation o Advisory roles, partnerships, or government-like affairs o Strong emphasis on earthly legacy (land, home, property) • This combination signifies a father who is intelligent, resourceful, but solitary, likely self-made. Wealth, Property & Buildings • The verse’s emphasis on “பலமான கட்டட முண்டாம்” (strong buildings) points toward: o Influence of Mars (construction, land) + Venus (comfort, architecture) + Mercury (planning, documentation). • Father may: o Be involved in land development, property investment, or architectural work o Own ancestral or acquired properties of long-standing nature Father’s Solitary Status • “தந்தை ஏகம்” implies that the father has no siblings or support system, or he lives independently. • Sun with Rahu may also signify: o Outcaste, foreign settler, or estranged familial role o Potential early abandonment or father living away from the family unit Pitrukarma at Age 11 Age Activation (BCP or Nadi Progression): • 11th year activates the 11th house: Capricorn • Saturn (lord of 11th) aspects 5th house where Sun + Rahu reside — triggering karma related to father • BCP logic aligns: o 5th house → 11th year (via BCP clock) o Hence, karmic responsibility and separation from the father may activate now Maraka Role: • Sun is in 6th from 10th (Saturn), and Mars as 2nd lord in Maraka sthana (7th) • Rahu’s placement further emphasises the preordained timing of the father’s departure • Jupiter is the 2nd lord of maraka from the 9th house. In its progression on the 11th year, Jupiter will be in Cancer with the Sun and Rahu, or in Leo, the 2nd house from the Sun and its maraka powers are activated. Spiritual Symbolism • Sun + Rahu = Jnana-karma-yoga — intense ancestral karma, possibly father involved in esoteric or unconventional spirituality • Jupiter’s role isn’t highlighted in this verse, but becomes relevant in the spiritual timing of rituals Summary Table Element Details Lagna Pisces Pitrukaraka Sun 5th house (Cancer) with Rahu 9th lord Mars 7th house (Virgo) with Mercury and Venus Father’s nature Lone, wealthy, strong dharmic karma, land/property-based profession Legacy & possessions Land, wealth, and strong buildings Timing of father's death Age 11 – due to karmic activation via BCP and Rahu + Maraka indications Additional Nadi Insight Rahu with Sun creates “Pitra Dosha”, Sun’s 7th placement from the 9th house. BCP Age Activation 11th house activation brings loss/funeral duty linked to father

TamilVerse: ஐந்தாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாயிருந்து லாபாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டு பாக்கியத்தில் பிதுர் ஸ்தானாதிபன் நீச்சனுடன் கூடி, மூன்றிலிருக்கும் ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கமிருவன். பிதா கைத்தொழில் மூலம் உபாய ஜீவனம் செய்வனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed alone in the 5th house (Cancer). Saturn (11th lord of gains) aspects the Sun from Capricorn. In the 9th house (Scorpio), Mars (9th lord, debilitated) and Moon (5th lord) are placed. Jupiter (10th lord) is placed in Taurus (3rd house) and aspects the 9th house. The native’s paternal lineage has two male members. The father earns a living through manual work or a craft-based profession. Astrological Interpretation Sun in the 5th House Alone • The Pitrukaraka Sun alone in the 5th house suggests: o A centralised and individual karma tied to the father o Possibly less interaction with siblings or paternal relatives o Strong focus on legacy, education, or meritorious karma associated with the paternal line Saturn’s Aspect from Capricorn (11th Lord) • Saturn's 10th aspect on the Sun reflects: o Karmic duties and responsibilities toward ancestral debt o A strong discipline or constraint imposed by paternal legacy o Since Saturn rules the 11th house, its aspect from its sign adds material stability but may also suggest delayed recognition of paternal identity or lineage Mars (9th lord) Debilitated in 9th • Mars, being both the 2nd and 9th lord, when debilitated, brings: o Loss of strength to paternal dharma o A strained relationship or instability in the father's status o Reduced authority or struggle in preserving tradition Moon with Mars in 9th • Moon, the 5th lord, when placed with Mars in the 9th: o Suggests the emotional influence of the father on the native’s ideology o Emotional inheritance of struggles or instability from the paternal side o May indicate a change in family beliefs or an early ideological rupture Jupiter in 3rd Aspecting 9th • Jupiter as Lagna and 10th lord placed in Taurus (3rd house) shows: o Strong willpower and action-oriented karma o As its aspect reaches the 9th house, it uplifts the otherwise weakened Mars–Moon conjunction o Gives spiritual support, ethical grounding, and possible teacher/guru support to the father o Also justifies the interpretation of father earning a livelihood by skills or craft, as the 3rd house rules hands, trade, and effort Paternal Line & Profession • "தந்தை வர்க்கமிருவன்" – Two male members in father’s lineage, possibly brothers or male cousins. • Mars, karaka for siblings in its own house, presence of Saturn in the 3rd house from the 9th house and Jupiter’s placement in the 11th house from the Sun gives two male siblings. • “கைத்தொழில் மூலம் ஜீவனம்” – Father is involved in manual labour, craftsmanship, technical work, or small business: o Supported by 3rd house Jupiter, aspecting 9th o Saturn’s karmic influence through the 11th-to-5th aspect also reinforces livelihood based on effort Age-Based Activation BCP Progression (5th House = 5th Year) • 5th year will be important for: o Relationship with father o Health or visibility of the father o Native’s early karmic imprint connected to paternal lineage Other Age Indicators • Saturn’s influence may delay the father's karmic resolution to maturity stages (after age 36) • Mars' debility may indicate some conflict or loss around the father between 8–12 years Summary Table Category Details Lagna Pisces Sun’s placement Alone in the 5th house (Cancer) Aspected by Saturn (11th lord) from Capricorn 9th house Mars (debilitated, 9th lord) + Moon (5th lord) Jupiter’s role From 3rd house, aspects 9th – supports father’s karma Paternal siblings Two males in the paternal lineage Father’s livelihood Based on skilled trade / manual effort (3rd house link, Saturn’s aspect) Timing BCP at 5 years, possible struggles later in
