TamilVerse: ஆறாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய், ஸ்வக்ஷேத்திரம் பெற்று பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை பஞ்சம திரிகோணமேறிய உச்சனால் பார்க்கப் பட்டால், பிதாவுடன் பெண்ணொன்று. பிதா முப்பத்து நான்கில் அரிட்டமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed alone in the 6th house (Leo), its sign (Swa-Kshetra). The 9th house (house of father) receives the aspect of exalted Jupiter, placed in the 5th house (Cancer), a trinal (trikona) house. • Result: o The native will have one female sibling along with the father. o The father will die when the native reaches the age of 34. Traditional Astrological Interpretation Sun in Own Sign (Leo) in 6th House • Sun as Pitrukaraka gains strength in its sign, showing a powerful paternal karmic link. • Placement in the 6th house, a house of conflict, service, and disease, subtly suggests: o Father may have endured conflict or health issues o Native's sense of duty and karma to father is heavy o Possible separation in a karmic or health-based context Jupiter in 5th House (Exalted) • Exalted Jupiter in Cancer represents benevolence, protection, dharma, and ancestral merit. • Its aspect to the 9th house: o Blesses the paternal house with wisdom, spiritual merit o Suggests support from father's lineage o However, due to Sun being placed in 6th, the father may still experience adversity despite merit Nadi Astrology Insight • Sun in 6th (alone) suggests a karmic isolation of the father. He is not surrounded by other karakas, suggesting he may have had an independent or detached life. • Placement in the 6th house in Swa-Kshetra (Leo) shows: o The father’s karma is service-oriented or involved in public or responsible duties. o He may have held authority in subordinate roles, like supervisory positions, or served the government or law. • Exalted Jupiter in a trikona (5th) aspecting 9th: o Strong ancestral support, blessings, and dharma carried forward. o Yet Sun in the 6th balances it with suffering and challenges tied to family karma. Siblings & Family Structure • “பிதாவுடன் பெண்ணொன்று” – One female sibling is present along with the father. • The 3rd house from the 9th house is aspected by Jupiter, giving the sibling. Jupiter, being placed in a female sign and aspecting a female sign, has given a female sibling. Timing of Father’s Death • “முப்பத்து நான்கில் பிதா மரணம்” – Death of the father occurs at age 34. BCP Age Progression Logic • 34th year = 10th house activation. • 10th house is the 2nd house of maraka for the 9th house. • 10th house lord Jupiter, being a maraka, is placed in the 8th house of longevity from the activation house and is also the 12th house o exit from the Sun. Planetary Progression Insight • At 34, Jupiter might be in Aries or Taurus. • Being a maraka for the father, Jupiter will aspect the Sun. If Jupiter is in  Taurus, it will be in the 7th from the 9th house, Spiritual Implications • This is a karmically balanced chart: o Exalted Jupiter preserves ancestral merit, but Sun in 6th causes outward suffering o Native may need to perform rituals/duties to uphold lineage merit o Pitrukarma around 34 will be significant Summary Table Aspect Detail Lagna Pisces Sun Alone in Leo (6th house), own sign (strong but karmic) Jupiter Exalted in Cancer (5th house), aspects 9th 9th house Empty but blessed by exalted Jupiter Siblings One female sibling Father’s Profession Service, public role, karmically disciplined Father’s Death Occurs at age 34 (timing linked to Jupiter progression / BCP 11th)

TamilVerse: ஆறாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை திருதியமேறிய லாப விரையாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டால் தந்தையுடன் ஆணாறு, கைத்தொழில் விர்த்தி. இருபத்திரண்டு வரையில் பிதுர், மாதுரு தீர்க்கமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 6th house (Leo) along with Mercury, the 4th and 7th lord (significators of comfort and spouse). This conjunction is aspected by Saturn, who is the 11th and 12th lord, placed in the 3rd house (Taurus). • Result: o The native’s father is accompanied by six male members (suggesting siblings). o The family is involved in hand-based skills or craftsmanship (கைத்தொழில்) o Both father and mother live until the native turns 22. Traditional Astrological Interpretation Sun + Mercury in Leo (6th House) • Sun is Swa-Kshetra (own sign) → Strengthens father's individuality and karmic role. • Mercury (4th and 7th lord) indicates: o Emphasis on domestic comfort, emotional education, and partner’s karma. o In the 6th house: suggests that the father may be engaged in service-oriented or manual roles. o Signifies intellect-based or small trade work. Saturn in Taurus (3rd House), Aspecting 9th • Saturn as 11th and 12th lord from Lagna implies: o Earnings and expenditures are closely linked to effort and karma. o Aspect on the 9th house from 3rd shows gradual maturation of paternal karma. o Promotes skill-based work (third house → hands, crafts). Nadi Insight • Sun + Mercury in 6th indicates: o Father was independent, possibly health-challenged, but worked with technical/hand-based skills. o Mercury's placement makes it a thinking worker, someone in a practical or applied profession. • Saturn’s aspect from the 3rd: o Promotes slow but steady success in handicrafts or vocational labour. o Saturn, being the dual lord (11th & 12th), also reflects gains through hard effort and spiritual detachment. Family Structure • “தந்தையுடன் ஆணாறு” – The father is associated with six male relatives, likely brothers or sons. • Mercury is the 11th lord from both the Sun and the 9th house. Saturn, the 3rd lord from the 9th house, aspects both Sun and Mercury. This conjunction and aspect have given six siblings. • The masculine count indicates a paternal lineage with strength and continuation. Timing of Parental Longevity • “இருபத்திரண்டு வரையில் பிதுர், மாதுரு தீர்க்கம்” o Both father and mother live up to native’s 22nd year. BCP Analysis • 22nd year activates the 10th house. As no influence on this house or the lord of this house by the given planets' karmic culmination applies to both father and mother. Planetary Progression Insight • During this age, if Saturn progression falls on the 12th house. Saturn is in Taurus. Taking two and a half years for a sign, Saturn is likely to be in Aquarius. This is the 7th house from the Sun and is the karaka for death; the father passes away. • The 4th house lord is Mercury, indicating the mother, and is with the Sun, and Saturn falls in the 7th from Mercury, also ending the life of the mother. • Sun in the 6th suggests a “withdrawal phase” for the father after this period. Summary Table Aspect Detail Lagna Pisces Sun In 6th (Leo), own sign – strong Mercury With Sun (4th/7th lord) – signifies partnership and comfort dynamics Saturn In 3rd (Taurus), aspecting 9th – karma linked to effort and livelihood Siblings Father has 6 male siblings or male figures around Profession Family associated with hand-based trade or crafts Parental Longevity Both parents alive until age 22

TamilVerse: ஆறாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் புதன் கேதுவுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் லாப விரையாதிபனேறியிருந்தால் பிதா வர்க்கம் ஆண் மூன்று. முப்பத்து மூன்றில் பிதுர் கண்டம், அடுத்து மாதுரு கர்மம், அப்பால் கஷ்ட பலனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is conjoined with Mercury and Ketu in the 6th house (Leo). The 9th house (Scorpio), representing the father, is occupied by Saturn, who is the 11th and 12th lord. • The father belongs to a paternal lineage of three males. • The father enters a critical health phase at the native’s age of 33. • This is followed by the death of the mother and a period of hardship for the native. Traditional Astrological Insights Sun + Mercury + Ketu in 6th House • Sun in Leo (own sign): Strong paternal karma. • Mercury (4th & 7th lord): Blends domestic comfort and partnership influences into the paternal karma. • Ketu: Indicates spiritual severance, detachment, and ancestral karmic burden. • Together in the 6th: The father is linked to service, disease, or karmic repayment, and detached responsibility. Saturn in 9th House (Scorpio) • Saturn as 11th & 12th lord placed in the 9th: o Indicates delayed paternal karma, long-standing obligations, and potential loss through lineage or legacy. o Aspecting the 3rd house → affects siblings and communication. o Saturn in Scorpio: Deep karmic cleansing through suffering, especially connected to paternal heritage. Nadi-based Insight • The Sun’s placement with Ketu implies a paternal figure with spiritual or renunciate tendencies. • Mercury in 6th can also imply skilled hands or traders, but when conjoined with Ketu and Sun, it shows a fragmented household. • The father's family has three male members — the karmic indication of limited continuation of the lineage. Family & Lineage Indication • "பிதா வர்க்கம் ஆண் மூன்று" — A paternal line with three male members is indicated. • Mercury is the 11th lord from the Sun as well as from the 9th house. Its conjunction with the Sun, as well as the aspect of Saturn, who is the third lord of siblings from the 9th house, has given three lineages with the father. • Ketu's conjunction weakens the binding; hence, the father may not have strong ties with the extended family. Timing Analysis Events: 1. Age 33: Father experiences "Kantaka Dasha" – a critical period. 2. Afterwards: Mother’s death – "Mathur Karma" follows. 3. Then: The native enters a difficult karmic phase. BCP / Nadi Progression Logic: • 33rd year → Activates the 9th house: o Saturn is placed here → classic sign of paternal illness or karmic closure. • 34th year → Activates 10th house (Sagittarius), linked with mother (Moon as 5th lord in Cancer) and public karma. Maraka house for the mother as 7th from the 4th house. • 35th onward: Saturn's influence over the 12th and 6th houses may initiate hardships, both personal and professional. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 6th House Sun (own sign), Mercury, Ketu – indicates karmic and health burdens in paternal line 9th House Saturn (11th/12th lord) – karmic pressure, delayed karma, death markers Siblings 3 male members in father’s lineage Age 33 Father's health crisis, likely death After 33 Mother’s death, followed by hardship for native

TamilVerse: ஆறாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் தனித்து ஒன்பதாமாதி சுக்கிரனுடன் பஞ்சம திரிகோணமேறி நீச்ச குருவால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் பிதா ஏகன், மேலான யோகமடைவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed alone in the 6th house (Leo). The 9th lord Mars is conjoined with Venus (lord of the 3rd and 8th houses) in the 5th house (Cancer), which is a Trikona (trinal) house. This combination is aspected by a debilitated Jupiter from Capricorn. The native’s father is said to be a lone figure (no siblings or close paternal associates) and will attain higher yogas—indicative of spiritual merit, success, or karmic reward. Traditional Astrological Insights Sun Alone in 6th House • Sun in Leo (own sign): Strong placement for paternal karma. • Alone: Indicates father was a solitary figure, possibly isolated due to karmic detachment or personal temperament. • In the 6th: Tied to service, health, or legal/dharma-based trials. Mars + Venus in 5th (Cancer) • Mars (9th lord): Paternal significator strong in a trinal house. • Venus (8th lord): Brings a hidden karmic edge or artistic leanings. • Mars-Venus in a watery sign (Cancer): Suggests a complex blend of energy, desire, and karmic refinement. Debilitated Jupiter in Capricorn (11th house) • Jupiter as Lagna and 10th lord is debilitated in the 11th: the house of gains, network, and realization. • Its aspect on the 5th house—despite debility—indicates delayed but potent blessings; “higher yogas” through effortful karma and spiritual debt resolution. Nadi-based Insight • Pitrukaraka Sun is alone in the 6th, signifying that the father’s karmic duty lies in solitude—he likely had to earn his merit without family support. • The presence of 9th lord Mars in a Trikona (5th) with 8th lord Venus shows the karmic reward following transformative struggle—hallmark of yogic results in Nadi readings. • Jupiter’s debility implies that the yogas gained are not effortless; they stem from overcoming limitations or obstructions, possibly rooted in prior karmas. Spiritual or Yogic Outcome • “மேலான யோகமடைவன்” = Greater Yogas → The phrase suggests that the father: o Had deep spiritual alignment o Benefited from hidden karmic merit o Rose above his circumstances, despite challenges implied by Jupiter’s debility Timing Consideration (BCP/Nadi Progression) • The key house involved is the 5th (Cancer)—trikona and linked to children, merit, and karmic fruit. • The Sun’s placement in the 6th suggests some resistance or delay. • When Jupiter progresses (as lord of Lagna and 10th) to the 5th (Cancer) or aspects it again, the yogic results of the father may manifest in the native’s life too—especially in the 24th–36th year. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 6th House Sun (Pitrukaraka) alone — strong but solitary paternal karma 5th House Mars (9th lord) + Venus (3rd/8th lord) — karmic lineage + potential fame 11th House Debilitated Jupiter — spiritual delays, eventual elevation Siblings None indicated for father (solitary figure) Father’s Result Attains “higher yogas” (spiritual elevation, karmic reward)

TamilVerse: ஆறாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக பஞ்சம சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் லாப விரையாதிபதியுடன் கேது கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கமிருவர் தீர்க்கம். வியாபாரம், பூமி மூலம் ஜீவனம். இருபத்தாறு வரையில் பிதா தீர்க்கமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is conjoined with Mercury (4th & 7th lord) and Moon (5th lord) in the 6th house (Leo). The 9th house (Scorpio) is occupied by Saturn (lord of 11th and 12th) and Ketu. This configuration indicates: • Two long-lived male members in the paternal lineage. • The father earns through land-related activity and trade. • The father is alive until the native turns 26. Nadi and Traditional Astrological Analysis Pitrukaraka in the 6th House with Benefics • The 6th house placement of Sun with benefic Mercury and Moon points to a karmic struggle but is supported by dharmic strength (Moon as 5th lord, Mercury as 4th & 7th). • Indicates the father had to work hard, especially in service-oriented or effort-based roles (6th house = effort, toil). Saturn and Ketu in the 9th House • Saturn, lord of labha (11th) and vyaya (12th) placed in 9th shows karmic inheritance of both gain and loss. • Ketu's presence in the 9th house represents paternal separation, ancestral austerity, or an inward-turning dharma. • Saturn's presence ensures longevity in the paternal line, albeit with detachment. Livelihood Insight • Trade is seen through Mercury (7th lord) in the 6th = transactional karma. • Land and property seen through the 4th lord Mercury and 9th house Saturn (karmic land lord). • Strong indicators for livelihood through trade and land. Timing – BCP/Nadi Age Progression • 26th year is key. As per Nadi logic: o Sun's movement or BCP (Bhava Chalit progression) to the 9th house (father's karma) may trigger culmination of the father's active karmic span. o Alternatively, Jupiter may progress to Scorpio, activating 9th house events. o Saturn in the 9th may reflect the father’s long life until Saturn's progression to 12th or 1st — a point of karmic shift. o Considering the actual progression of Saturn, Saturn might be in Virgo, which is the 2nd house of maraka from the Sun. Spiritual Reading • Sun-Moon-Mercury trio = a karmic blend of soul, mind, and intellect — auspicious for merit-based fatherly lineage. • Presence of Ketu in the 9th signals a spiritual tone to the father’s life, possibly a lack of interest in family later, or a turn to spiritual pursuits. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 6th House (Leo) Sun (Pitrukaraka), Mercury (4th/7th lord), Moon (5th lord) 9th House (Scorpio) Saturn (11th/12th lord), Ketu Siblings (Paternal Line) Two males, long-lived Father's Profession Based on trade (Mercury/7th) and land/property (4th + Saturn) Father's Longevity Till the native’s age of 26 years Spiritual Implication Ketu in 9th = ancestral moksha link or spiritual leanings Sun in 7th house-Virgo ஏழாமிடம்

TamilVerse: ஏழாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் நீச்சனுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் பஞ்சமாதிபதியான சந்திரன் நீச்சமடைந்திருந்தால் ஜாதகன் ஜெனித்த மூன்று திங்கள் முதல் தந்தைக்கு உத்தியோக மேன்மையுண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 7th house (Virgo) along with Venus, who is debilitated in this sign. In the 9th house (Scorpio), the Moon, which is the 5th lord, is also debilitated. This planetary configuration indicates that within three months of the native's birth, the father will receive a promotion or elevation in his professional life. Astrological Analysis Traditional Astrology View • Sun in the 7th house often indicates partnerships, visibility, and external recognition. • Debilitated Venus may reduce domestic comfort or personal pleasures, but does not directly harm the father's position. • Debilitated Moon in the 9th house usually suggests weak support from ancestors or fortune, but in this context, it marks a triggering event for the father. Despite both Venus and Moon being debilitated, the Sun’s placement in a Kendra (7th) and its connection to the Karmic 9th house trigger a visible karmic elevation for the father. Nadi Principle Insight • The debilitation of Venus and Moon, often linked with past-life karma, suggests the father has endured difficulty and now receives karmic compensation. • Sun in the 7th house, a strong directional house, is poised to activate karmic fruition post-birth of the child. • In Nadi parlance, the birth of the child is the trigger; the native’s karmic arrival releases the father’s latent merits, resulting in a job promotion or a new opportunity. Timing Logic – BCP / Nadi Age Progression • At 3 months post-birth, the progression of Moon (fastest planet) would reach or influence the 10th house (career of father). • The Sun in Kendra may be activated via Saturn or Jupiter’s progression, indirectly giving material gain to the father. • Alternatively, Rahu/Ketu transit over the 9th house at birth could activate the Moon, bringing material promotion for the father. Spiritual/Karmic Interpretation • The native’s birth acts as a catalyst to resolve a karmic blockage in the father’s life. • Though both Moon and Venus are debilitated, they are functional lords of benefic houses (5th and 7th/8th). Their karmic trials produce a delayed but positive effect. • Such placements hint that the native is born into a family at a critical juncture, bringing material rise to the father, while possibly carrying spiritual challenges for the self. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 7th House (Virgo) Sun (Pitrukaraka), Venus (debilitated) 9th House (Scorpio) Moon (5th lord, debilitated) Father's Career Receives promotion within 3 months after the native’s birth Siblings (Implied) Not mentioned Spiritual Significance Native’s birth clears father's karmic block, despite planetary weakness.

TamilVerse: ஏழாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக்கிரன், ராகு இவர்களுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் நீச்சனிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கமூன்று, பதினெட்டில் பிரிவுபடும், இருபத்தைந்தில் பிதுர் மரணமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 7th house (Virgo) along with Venus and Rahu. In the 9th house (Scorpio), the Moon—the 5th lord—is placed in debilitation. This configuration reveals: • There are three members in the paternal lineage. • At the age of 18, the family will disintegrate. • The father dies in the native’s 25th year. Astrological Analysis Traditional Astrology Insight • Sun in the 7th gives prominence to external relations and marital/partnership dynamics, which also indicates visibility of the father. • Venus debilitated in Virgo affects family harmony and conjugal dynamics, both for the father and indirectly the native. • Rahu's conjunction intensifies this by creating unconventional or unstable family patterns. • Debilitated Moon in the 9th house, the seat of father, dharma, and luck, shows weak ancestral support and emotional disconnection. This suggests: • A fractured or karmically strained paternal lineage, with early disruption at age 18 and final severance (father's death) at 25. Nadi Principle Insight • The presence of Sun + Rahu + Venus in the 7th (a Kendra) is highly karmic. Rahu conjunct Sun often indicates paternal obscurity, unexpected changes, and unconventional karma. • Debilitated Moon in the 9th amplifies the sense of karmic debt and family disintegration. • The sequence of events (separation at 18, death at 25) reflects Nadi age-progression logic, where malefic planets trigger critical life events. Timing and Progression 🔹 Age 18 – Separation • Could be triggered by Rahu progression (Rahu/Sun conjunction in 7th house activating 9th). • Venus's weakness may cause a break in domestic unity, possibly through relocation, legal issues, or emotional separation. • Debilitation of Venus and the mother, and the presence of Rahu with the Sun, activate the disintegration of the family because the 6th house is activated and the 6th lord is under the above influences. 🔹 Age 25 – Father's Death • Debilitated Moon in 9th becomes fully activated in Saturn or Jupiter progression. • Rahu's latent karmic disturbance may culminate around this period, particularly under Ketu dasha or Rahu's return (18-year cycle). • The presence of both Sun and Rahu in Kendra is often tied to timely but intense karmic events. • As per BCP, the first house is activated and is under the influences of Rahu and debilitated Venus, and above all, the Sun is placed there. Spiritual & Karmic Interpretation • Native is born into a karmically strained paternal lineage. • Rahu and debilitated Moon reflect inherited karma and emotional instability connected to the father's line. • The disintegration at age 18 may represent estrangement, loss of patrimony, or a break in the dharmic connection. • The father's death at 25 marks the end of the paternal karmic role, possibly after a tumultuous or spiritually significant journey. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 7th House Sun (Pitrukaraka), Venus (Debilitated), Rahu 9th House Moon (Debilitated, 5th Lord) Siblings (Paternal Line) Three males in the father’s lineage Event at Age 18 Separation or disintegration in the paternal family Event at Age 25 Father’s death Karmic Themes Emotional disconnection, ancestral detachment, Rahu’s transformative role

TamilVerse: ஏழாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் நின்று லக்கின கேந்திரம் பெற்ற ஜென்ம கர்ம லாப விரையாதிபதிகளால் பார்க்கப்பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்க மூன்றிலொருவன் மத்தியில் மரணம். தந்தை சில நாள் சுகமும் பின்னால் துன்பமும் படுவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In Pisces Lagna, the Pitrukaraka Sun is placed alone in the 7th house (Virgo). It receives aspects from: • Jupiter, lord of Lagna and 10th house (Kendra influence), • Saturn, lord of the 11th and 12th houses.-both placed in Lagna The verse states: • Among three paternal siblings, one dies in the middle age. • The father will enjoy comforts for a period but will later experience troubles and suffering. Astrological Interpretation Traditional Astrology Perspective • Sun alone in 7th denotes visibility and karmic maturity in partnerships or public roles; here, its lone placement emphasises isolation or karmic autonomy about the father. • Jupiter's aspect from Sagittarius (own house) gives protection, knowledge, and righteousness, suggesting the father initially enjoys prestige and comfort. • Saturn’s aspect brings the inevitable karma of suffering, loss, or detachment, leading to a decline in fortunes. Interpretation: • The father’s life includes contrasting phases — early or mid-life success followed by gradual decline. • Among paternal uncles (or male lineage), one will die in middle age, indicating interrupted family continuity. Nadi Principle Insight • The Sun placed alone often indicates a solitary karmic role of the father, possibly single-handedly managing or being the only prominent male figure in the paternal line. • Jupiter’s drishti as Lagna/10th lord gives bhagya and karma-siddhi, supporting the father's rise. • But Saturn, being lord of the loss house (12th) and gains (11th), when aspecting Sun, causes: o Sudden reversal of fortunes o Loss of vitality or prestige o Transition from success to sorrow From Nadi's view, this split of joy and grief indicates a destined shift in karma, usually due to ancestral or collective karmic burden. Timing and Life Events • Although no explicit age is mentioned, the phrase "in the middle" aligns with Saturnian ages— typically mid-30s to mid-50s for major karmic events. • The father’s comfort phase could align with Jupiter progression (early adulthood), and trouble begins under Saturn progression (from 36–42 years). • The death of the sibling (uncle) occurs in the middle period—this could also trigger a karmic shift or sorrow in the paternal line. Spiritual & Karmic Themes • The verse illustrates karmic impermanence: joy is not permanent, and dharma must guide the response to loss. • Jupiter’s grace karmically elevates the father, but Saturn brings him to humility, a lesson in renunciation or detachment. • For the native, witnessing these transitions builds empathy and respect for karmic balance. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 7th House Sun (alone – Pitrukaraka) Aspects on the Sun Jupiter (Lagna/10th lord) from 10th; Saturn (11th/12th lord) from 11th Paternal Line Three males; one dies in middle age Father’s Life Phases Comfort/recognition → followed by suffering/diminishment Karmic Message Joy and sorrow alternate through karmic timing

TamilVerse: ஏழாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சந்திரன், சுக்கிரன், கேது இவர்களுடன் கூடியிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் ஐந்து, பெண் எட்டில் தீர்க்கம் ஆணிரண்டு, பெண்ணான்கு. எட்டு வயதில் பிதாவுக்குக் கர்மமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: To Pisces Lagna, the Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 7th house (Virgo) along with Moon (5th lord), Venus (3rd and 8th lord), and Ketu. • In the father’s lineage, there are five male and eight female siblings, out of which two males and four females are long-lived. • The native performs the final rites for the father at the age of 8. Astrological Interpretation Traditional Insight • Sun in 7th house with Venus, Moon, and Ketu: o Sun becomes combust and eclipsed, affecting paternal strength. o Moon + Ketu: emotional disconnection; early detachment from family. o Venus (8th lord) in 7th intensifies longevity issues and marital dualities (father’s multiple relations). • Large sibling group in paternal line signifies strong lineage, but longevity is restricted. o Of 13 total, only six are long-lived — indicating heavy karmic pruning. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun with Ketu in the 7th suggests: o Early severance or loss of father’s presence. o Ketu often represents ancestral debts or past-life karmic severance. • The presence of Venus (8th lord) tightens karmic loops around sudden transformations and early death. • Moon’s presence adds emotional weight and memory to the karmic load — this could trigger early rites by the native, hence the father’s death by age 8. • Gender and longevity breakdown aligns with fixed karmic allotment often seen in Nadi astrology — not everyone in the family gets karmic “permission” to live long. Timing – BCP / Nadi Progression • At age 8, Sun may progress to the Ascendant or 8th house, forming strong Maraka or end-of-karma positions. • Ketu is often seen active around early-life karmic endings — its influence here supports the timing of the father’s death. • The progression of Venus (8th lord) or Moon (emotional severance) could also be triggering the event at that age. • As per BCP, the 8th house of the native is activated. The 8th house is the 12th house from the 9th house and 2nd house from the Sun, both indicating maraka. The lord of the 8th house is in debility and is with Sun, the father and the mokshakaraka Ketu. Spiritual/Karmic Insight • The verse outlines the severance of paternal karma early in life. • Ketu’s placement emphasises detachment, both physically (loss of father) and emotionally (memory imprint). • This configuration can manifest as early maturity, with the native bearing the weight of responsibility and ancestral rites while still a child. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 7th House Sun (Pitrukaraka), Moon (5th lord), Venus (3rd & 8th lord), Ketu Father’s Lineage 5 males, 8 females; 2 males + 4 females are long-lived Father’s Death Native performs last rites at age 8 Karmic Themes Substantial ancestral burden, early detachment, emotional and dharmic testing Spiritual Note Ketu’s involvement indicates early moksha-karma activation

TamilVerse: ஏழாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தை உச்ச சந்திரனால் பார்க்கப் பட்டால் முப்பது வரையில் தந்தைக்கு திர்க்கமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 7th house (Virgo) to Pisces Lagna, along with Mercury, the lord of the 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalatra) houses. The 9th house (house of father and fortune) is aspected by the exalted Moon from Taurus. This configuration suggests that the native's father will live up to the age of 30. Astrological Interpretation Traditional Insight • Sun in 7th house (Virgo) signifies focus on external partnerships, but here, it reflects the father's presence in public or vocational life. • Mercury in its sign (Virgo) adds intelligence, trade inclination, and adaptive skills to the father. • Moon exalted in 3rd and aspecting 9th house (Scorpio) is significant. Moon, being the 5th lord, adds beneficence, emotional support, and a softening influence on the karma of the 9th house. o This is a protective placement, enhancing longevity and emotional bond with the father. • Overall, this combination supports the father’s good health and sustenance until age 30 of the native. Nadi Principle Insight • Sun + Mercury (Budha Aditya Yoga) in a Kendra (7th) is a noble Yoga suggesting an intellectual and articulate paternal figure. • Exalted Moon aspecting the 9th house gives emotional karmic protection over paternal matters. • In Nadi principles, the benefic aspect on the 9th house from a strong Chandra delays karmic culmination like death or separation. o Thus, the father is shielded at least until a specific age threshold, here clearly stated as 30 years. Timing – BCP / Progression Model • At age 30, the native enters into a new progression cycle. o Moon as 5th lord may be transiting via Kendra or Dusthana from the natal 9th house during this transition, indicating a change in paternal karma. • Alternatively, Saturn or Mars progression to key houses like the 9th or 8th may trigger end-of-life themes around this period. • Moon’s protection holds until this threshold, and the shift beyond age 30 might bring activation of new karmic debts (Rina Bandhana). Spiritual/Karmic Insight • The father is shown to be intellectually competent and emotionally attuned during the native’s formative years. • The native inherits a karmically privileged paternal period, which may shift sharply post-30 due to latent karmic obligations. • The emotional and material support from the father is assured until the threshold, after which dharmic independence is likely. Summary Table Aspect Details Lagna Pisces 7th House Sun (Pitrukaraka), Mercury (4th & 7th lord) 9th House (Scorpio) Aspected by exalted Moon (from 3rd house - Taurus) Result Father will be alive until age 30 Father’s Traits Articulate, intelligent, steady till age 30 Timing Logic Moon’s exalted aspect delays karmic culmination; next phase likely post-30 Spiritual Note Karma supports strong Sun in 8th house-Libra எட்டாமிடம்

TamilVerse: எட்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் நீச்சனாய் சனியுடன் கூடி நீச்ச செவ்வாயால் பார்க்கப்பட்டு பிதுர் ஸ்தானத்தில் சுக பஞ்சம சப்தமாதிபர்களேறியிருந்தால் பிதா இருவர், அன்னிய தேச மரணமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In the 8th house (Pisces), the Pitrukaraka Sun is in debilitation and is conjoined with Saturn. This combination is aspected by debilitated Mars from the Cancer. In the 9th house (Scorpio), Mercury (4th and 7th lord) and Moon (5th lord) are placed. This planetary configuration suggests that: • There are two paternal figures (likely father and one male sibling). • The father dies in a foreign land, signifying karmic dislocation and separation. Traditional Astrological Analysis • Sun in the 8th house is considered inauspicious for longevity and paternal stability. Debilitation further weakens its significations. • Saturn's conjunction with the debilitated Sun implies paternal hardships, isolation, and karmic weight. • Mars, though lord of 2nd and 9th, being debilitated in the 5th, sends a weak but malefic aspect, intensifying the affliction. • The 9th house, occupied by Moon and Mercury, brings emotional and intellectual connections with the father but also fluctuations or displacement (Moon) and business/profession-related motion (Mercury). • Mars as 9th lord placed in debility and aspecting the 8th house strongly supports the idea of foreign death. Nadi Insight • Nadi astrology often treats the 8th house as a powerful karmic reservoir. Sun placed here, especially in Libra, suggests that the father's karmic debts are heavy. • Placement in Libra often denotes death in a place of judgment or foreign land — i.e., not in familiar or domestic settings. • Mars’ debility removes the protective influence of the 9th lord, while Moon and Mercury indicate the father’s life path is emotionally disturbed and materially active — he may have moved for work or duty. Sibling & Lineage Reading • "பிதா இருவர்" is interpreted in Nadi style as two male figures in paternal lineage: o Father and paternal uncle o Or father and grandfather • It doesn’t necessarily mean polygamy, but dual male lineage presence. • The 3rd lord from the 9th house is Saturn, and it is exalted. Saturn by himself restricts expansion. Saturn might be combust also, hence one sibling to the father, • Karaka for sibling Mars is debilitated, and Saturn’s aspect may further reduce the siblings. • Sun also represents a sibling as the 11th lord from the self, but himself is debilitated. Timing of Death (Progression Logic) • Sun in the 8th (Libra) progresses into Scorpio and Sagittarius around age 30–36. • Mars, being the afflicted 9th lord, can act as maraka, especially during its Dasa or Antardasa. • Saturn-Sun conjunction triggers heavy karma — if Saturn Dasa runs during early adulthood, it could match the prediction. • Since Sun is in a Dusthana and debilitated, and Mars is also weak, father’s death is more likely under Rahu, Mars, or Saturn Dasa. • Location of death in a foreign land is indicated by: o 8th house placement (separation) o Aspect from debilitated Mars (disturbance) o Mercury in 9th (foreign travel) o Saturn with Sun (karma of exile) o The 12th house or its lord is also responsible for death in a foreign land. Here, the 12th lord Saturn is with the Sun and is placed in the 12th house to the 9th house. Summary Table Aspect Description Lagna Pisces Sun Placement 8th house (Libra), debilitated Conjunction Saturn Aspected by Debilitated Mars from the 5th 9th House Mercury and Moon Siblings Two male paternal figures Father's Fate Dies in a foreign land Timing Clue Rahu, Mars or Saturn periods likely trigger the event

TamilVerse: எட்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் புதன் கரும்பாம்பு இவர்களுடன் கூடி குடும்பமேறிய ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் எட்டு, நிலைப்பு மூன்று. இருபதில் பிதுர் கர்மமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In Pisces Lagna, the Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 8th house (Libra) along with Mercury and Rahu. The combination is aspected by Jupiter, which is placed in the 2nd house (Aries). The native’s paternal lineage consists of eight male members, but only three survive long-term. The native performs the final rites for his father at the age of 20. Traditional Astrology Interpretation • Sun in the 8th house is naturally a sign of diminished paternal vitality and early separation. • Mercury, as the 3rd and 7th lord, conjoining the Sun in the 8th, shows complex karmas connected to siblings and marital affairs of the father. • Rahu, amplifying and distorting the Sun’s qualities, further weakens the paternal significator. • Jupiter, though exalted in Aries (2nd house), casts its 5th aspect to the 8th house. While benefic in nature, this is not strong enough to protect the afflicted Sun–Rahu combination. • Jupiter’s role as the Lagna and 10th lord signals a karmic obligation for the native, especially relating to performing duties and rituals (2nd house). Nadi Insight In Nadi astrology, a Sun–Mercury–Rahu conjunction in the 8th house from Pisces Lagna indicates: • A highly karmic paternal lineage, with elements of intellectual instability, sudden changes, and loss through ancestral karma. • Rahu with Sun disrupts lineage, authority, and continuity. • Eight male figures in the paternal line suggest a large family tree. • Jupiter, Mercury and Sun all own houses representing the siblings of the father. There is a mutual aspect between the planets. Hence the large number of siblings. • The presence of Rahu reduces the siblings. • Only three survive because of afflictions and inherited karmic blocks. The presence of Jupiter in the 2nd shows that the native has the dharmic burden to uphold rituals, especially those linked to the father’s passing. Timing of Father’s Death 🔹 BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati) • Age 20 corresponds to the 8th house in BCP progression. • Since Sun, Mercury, and Rahu are already in the 8th house, the karmic energy of that year becomes heavy. • BCP directly confirms the event of the father's death at 20. 🔹 Planetary Progression / Dasha Perspective • Sun–Rahu conjunction is a potent indicator of eclipsing authority figures, especially during Sun–Rahu, Rahu–Sun, or Rahu–Mercury periods. • Jupiter, being in a neutral position, only facilitates karmic realisation, not reversal. Lineage Reading Element Interpretation Father’s Lineage 8 male members in total Surviving Members 3 males long-lived Death Timing Age 20 of the native Family Impact Early instability, karmic purification Summary Table Element Detail Lagna Pisces Sun Placement 8th house (Libra), with Mercury & Rahu Aspect on Sun Jupiter from the 2nd house (Aries) Lineage Count 8 male paternal figures Survivors 3 males Death of Father Native’s age 20 Indicated Causes Strong karmic influence, disruption Dasha/Bhava BCP 8th year progression (Age 20)

TamilVerse: எட்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் ஏகனாய் நின்று சுக சப்தமாதிபதியான புதன் கேதுவுடன் பிதுர் ஸ்தானமேறி லாப விரையாதிபதியால் நேரே பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தைக்குத் தாரமிரண்டு, தந்தை இருபத்திரண்டில் மரணமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Lagna: Pisces (Meena) • Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed alone in the 8th house (Libra), in debilitation. • Mercury (lord of 4th and 7th houses – sukha and kalatra) and Ketu are placed in the 9th house (Scorpio). • Saturn, the 11th and 12th lord, aspects the 9th house. • Result: Father has two wives. Father dies at the native’s age of 22. 1. Traditional Astrology Principles • Sun in 8th House (Debilitated in Libra): o Indicates challenges to the vitality of the karaka—in this case, father. o Being in debilitation and alone, it weakens the father’s life force and karmic legacy. • Mercury (4th & 7th Lord) and Ketu in 9th House (Scorpio): o Mercury, representing comfort (4th) and spouse (7th), placed in the house of the father, suggests the influence of spouse-related karma on the paternal line. o Ketu here can denote detachment, loss, or renunciation associated with the father or ancestral lineage. • Saturn's Aspect (11th and 12th Lord): o Saturn’s direct aspect from Taurus implies loss and karmic delays, affecting the 9th house. o 12th lordship confirms the theme of departure or separation from the father. • Two marriages for the father: o Mercury as the 7th lord signifies multiple relationships, and its placement in the 9th house supports this. o Ketu amplifies breaks or dualities in paternal relationships. 2. Nadi Principle Insights • Sun in the 8th house denotes Pitra Dosha and deep ancestral karmas. • The lonely position of the Sun, unsupported by benefics, emphasises ancestral pain or karmic burden. • Placement of Mercury and Ketu in the 9th is a direct pointer in Nadi texts to split paternal legacy or dual marriages. • Saturn's aspect on the 9th house underlines karmic completion by age 22, supported by numerous similar verses. 3. Age-wise Timing (BCP / Nadi Age Progression) BCP Logic: • At age 22, the 10th house (Sagittarius) becomes active (Pisces Lagna). o Saturn is lord of 12th; it aspects the 9th house. o Sagittarius is the 2nd house of maraka from the 9th house. Planetary Progression: • Jupiter and Saturn’s progression may have crossed the 9th or 2nd (Maraka from 9th). • Sun in the 8th house, when its cycle activates, may trigger critical events relating to the longevity of the father. Summary Table – Verse 38 Component Details Lagna Pisces (Meena) Sun (Pitrukaraka) 8th house (Libra) – debilitated, alone Mercury & Ketu 9th house (Scorpio) – 4th, 7th lords + moksha karaka Saturn 11th & 12th lord, aspects 9th house Father’s Profile Two marriages (due to Mercury + Ketu influence) Eventual Outcome The father died at the age of 22, a native. Key Nadi Insight Sun alone in 8th, Mercury-Ketu in 9th + Saturn’s drishti = Pitra Dosha BCP Trigger 12th house (Aquarius) active at age 22 – house of loss (Saturn lord) Conclusion This verse presents a classical example of dual paternal karma—one of legacy and loss. The Sun's isolation in debilitation, coupled with Ketu-Mercury in the 9th and Saturn’s karmic gaze, fulfils the Nadi prediction with astrological accuracy. We observe here how planetary positions mirror karmic stories, primarily through the lens of Nadi Jyotisha and age-progression models.

TamilVerse: எட்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் செவ்வாய், ராகு இவர்களுடன் கூடி கிரக ஸ்தானமேறிய ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகன், கிருஷி மூலம் ஜீவிப்பனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Lagna: Pisces (Meena) Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 8th house (Libra). Mars (9th and 2nd lord – Father & Wealth), and Rahu are also placed in the 8th house. Jupiter (Lagna and 10th lord) is placed in the 4th house (Gemini) and aspects the 8th house. Father is a lone person, and his livelihood is through agriculture (Krishi). 1. Traditional Astrology Principles Sun, Mars, Rahu in 8th House: • The 8th house is associated with longevity, sudden transformations, secrets, and ancestral karma. • The Sun, karaka of father, being in the 8th, shows vulnerability or challenges regarding the father’s life and karmic path. • Mars, as the 9th lord, conjoining the Sun here, shows: o Father is dominant or aggressive, yet tied to transformative experiences. o It links ancestral karma (9th) directly to deep karmic house (8th). • Rahu adds an unconventional or intensified karmic flavour – often linked with foreign lands, sudden changes, or manual/earth-bound professions. Jupiter’s Aspect from the 4th House: • Jupiter as Lagna and 10th lord placed in the 4th (Sukha sthana), representing land, property, and comforts. • Its aspect on the 8th house stabilizes the otherwise intense placement of Sun-Mars-Rahu. • Jupiter's placement in the 4th and aspect on the 8th (land-based karma) strongly ties the father’s livelihood to agriculture, land dealings, or rural profession. Father Being "Alone": • No benefics with the Sun, no support in Kendra houses. • Rahu’s presence with Mars in the 8th symbolises broken ties, secrecy, or solitary paths. • A lone father is also consistent with Nadi logic when Sun is unaccompanied by family-house lords (like 3rd, 5th, 11th, etc.). 2. Nadi Principle Insights • Nadi Texts often treat the Sun in the 8th with malefics as a marker of ancestral burden. • When Mars, the 9th lord, joins the Sun in the 8th, it signifies that the father’s karma is steeped in survival, isolation, or transformation. • Rahu’s involvement implies uncertainty or instability, especially in early life. • Jupiter’s aspect salvages this condition — and its location in the 4th, which rules over land and dwellings, makes agriculture the most likely and dharmic livelihood. 3. Timing Insights (Age-wise Progression) This verse doesn’t mention the exact age of death, but we can evaluate the timing of profession/loneliness themes using: BCP Model: • The 8th house (Libra) becomes active in the 21st year of the native. o At this time, Sun-Mars-Rahu karma activates. o This may coincide with a major shift in the father’s profession, or even a separation in the father’s path. Planetary Progression: • Jupiter’s movement to aspecting the 8th or transiting Libra may mark times when land/profession themes emerge for the father. • The Mars cycle may show the initiation of agriculture or related works. Summary Table – Verse 39 Component Details Lagna Pisces (Meena) Sun (Pitrukaraka) 8th house (Libra) Mars (9th, 2nd lord) In the 8th house – ties father, wealth to transformative karma Rahu In 8th – intensifies karmic impact, isolation Jupiter (Lagna, 10th) In 4th house – aspects 8th, promotes land-based dharmic occupation Result Father is alone, and agriculture is his profession. Nadi Insight Sun-Mars-Rahu in 8th: ancestral burden; Jupiter gives dharmic pathway BCP Timing 8th house active in 21st year – marks profession shift/father theme Conclusion This verse reveals how a powerful karmic alignment in the 8th can be transformed into a productive livelihood through Jupiter’s dharmic guidance. The father’s solitary nature, his dependence on agriculture, and the emotional weight of lineage are all encapsulated in this combination of Sun, Mars, Rahu, and Jupiter. This is a typical Nadi-style pointer to hidden karma expressed through land and solitude.

TamilVerse: எட்டாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதியுடன் கூடி விரைய ஸ்தானமேறிய ஜென்ம கர்மாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகம். தேச சஞ்சாரி, பிதுர் வர்க்கம் விர்த்தியில்லை யென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Lagna: Pisces (Meena) • Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 8th house (Libra). • Conjoined with Mercury, lord of 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalatra). • Jupiter, the Lagna and 10th lord (Karma Adhipati), is placed in Aquarius, the 12th house (Vyaya Sthana), and aspects the Sun and Mercury in the 8th. • Result: o Father is alone (no paternal siblings with progress), o Engages in travel or wandering, o Father's lineage lacks vocational advancement or worldly success. 1. Traditional Astrology Analysis Sun + Mercury in 8th House (Libra): • The 8th house denotes longevity, inheritance, secrecy, and hidden transformations. • Sun, being the Pitrukaraka, in the 8th shows karmic burden linked to the father, especially hidden or disruptive elements. • Mercury, the 4th and 7th lord, here does not confer domestic peace or stable marital partnerships for the father. • The 8th house Mercury often makes a clever, wandering, or mentally restless person. Jupiter in the 12th house (Aquarius) aspecting the 8th: • Jupiter, Lagna and Karma lord, represents dharma, fortune, and profession. • When placed in the 12th, it indicates foreign connection, exile, expenses, or withdrawal from active worldly karma. • Its aspect on the 8th is weakening in practical results – it lends spirituality, but not material fulfilment. • This Jupiter from Vyaya Sthana indicates the father is detached, wandering, and karma-less (professionally stagnant). 2. Nadi Astrology Interpretation • Sun in the 8th house with Mercury signifies a paternal figure whose karma is buried in the past – often a lone soul, potentially separated from the family by fate or choice. • Nadi tradition considers such placements as signs of "vritti abhava" – lack of consistent livelihood or meaningful career progress. • Jupiter from the 12th house, instead of protecting, amplifies isolation and spiritual wandering. • "Desa sanchaari" is a typical result of a 12th house Jupiter influencing the Sun: a life of movement, instability, or even exile. 3. Timing & Progression Indicators BCP Age Activation: • 8th house activates at age 21, marking a turning point related to father’s separation, detachment or wandering. • The 12th house (Jupiter’s position) activates at 25, often indicating loss, withdrawal, or spiritual detachment themes. Jupiter’s Progression: • Jupiter’s placement in Aquarius, the natural 11th sign, does not favour material fatherly gains, though it may allow spiritual or isolated existence. • In its return or transit through Leo (8th house) or Libra (Sun’s position), this wandering and detachment gets re-activated. Summary Table – Verse 40 Component Details Lagna Pisces (Meena) Sun (Pitrukaraka) 8th house (Libra), conjoined with Mercury (4th & 7th lord) Jupiter (Lagna + Karma) 12th house (Aquarius), aspects Sun & Mercury Result Father is a lone, nomadic individual with a lineage that lacks vocational growth. Nadi Insight Paternal karma is incomplete; the father detaches early from society. Timing Notes 8th house activates at 21, 12th house at 25 Conclusion This verse profoundly illustrates the faded paternal karma with themes of isolation, wandering, and dharmic withdrawal. The Sun in the 8th house with Mercury and Jupiter from the 12th gives a father who lives alone, possibly estranged, and whose lineage carries no visible legacy of worldly success. It also cautions that the native's connection to paternal karma is fragile, often requiring spiritual atonement or detachment. Summary table from Verses 21 to 40 Verse No. Planetary Position Result 21 Sun and Mercury in Leo; Rahu and Jupiter in Scorpio Two male siblings; difficulty at birth; father will disappear 22 Sun, Moon, Venus, Saturn in Cancer (5th); TamilVerse: ஒன்பதாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி புத்திர ஸ்தானத்தை சனி பத்தாம் பார்வை பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் நான்கு, பிதா அரசாங்கத்தை யடுத்தவனாய் காய சித்தியை விரும்புவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: Lagna: Pisces Sun (Pitrukaraka) is in the 9th house (Scorpio), Mercury (4th and 7th lord – Sukha and Kalathra) is conjoined with the Sun, Saturn, likely placed in the 8th house, aspects the 5th house (Putra Sthana) with its 10th aspect • Father’s lineage has four male siblings • Father is aligned with the government • Inclined towards Kaya siddhi (spiritual and physical perfection practices) Traditional Parashara-Based Analysis Planetary Placements: • Sun + Mercury in Scorpio (9th House): This Budha-Aditya yoga in the house of Dharma emphasises intelligence, influence, and leadership in paternal matters. The Sun in Scorpio also shows intensity and transformational karma linked to the father. • Saturn Aspecting 5th House: Saturn’s 10th aspect from the 8th house (Libra) to the 5th house (Cancer) slows or delays progeny, but also gives deep thought and spiritual wisdom. Saturn from the 8th suggests karmic burden and ancestral debt. Interpretation: • The father may be disciplined, bureaucratically aligned, or even a civil servant. • Interest in Siddha (Kaya siddhi) practices—related to healing, longevity, and yogic mastery—arises due to the Scorpio influence, Mercury's intellect, and Saturn’s transformative nature. Nadi Astrology Insights Nadi astrology often emphasises the exact house positions and interplay of significators, especially involving: • Sun (Pitrukaraka) = Karaka for father • 9th House = Father’s fate and lineage • 5th House = Past-life karmas, intelligence, and children (also relevant for father’s karma) Verse Breakdown in Nadi Terms: • Sun + Mercury in 9th: Shows father is the pivot of lineage, possibly well-established or tied to governmental karma. • Saturn aspecting 5th house: Indicates karma related to children, possibly a delay or austerity in the family system, and the father’s orientation toward spiritual discipline or austerity (Siddhi yoga). • The "அரசாங்கம்" (government) linkage and "காயசித்தி" interest appear as coded karma, showing the father combines worldly (bureaucratic) and spiritual (ascetic) domains. Sibling Structure The text says: "தந்தை வர்க்கம் ஆண் நான்கு" Indicates four male members on the father’s side, likely including the father and three brothers. The presence of Saturn (symbol of austerity and male karmic pattern) also supports a predominantly masculine lineage. The 3rd lord Saturn from the 9th house, exalted and placed in a male sign, indicates male siblings. Spiritual Inclination: Kayasiddhi Kayasiddhi refers to mastery over the body through yogic or alchemical practices, often pursued by sages in the Tamil Siddha tradition. This is beautifully tied to: • Scorpio (Sun’s placement) → intense transformation, control over physical forces • Mercury → intellect and secret knowledge • Saturn → austerity, discipline, yogic practices from the 8th house So this is not just administrative karma, but spiritual austerity linked to occult mastery, making the father’s profile dually worldly and mystical. Timing & Progression Considerations Even though this verse doesn’t state the age of death, it suggests karmic purpose and alignment: • Sun in Scorpio activates deep karma around ages 22–24 and 44–48, depending on progression. • Saturn aspecting the 5th house might relate to Saturnian dasa, where the father's influence on the progeny is tested or intensified. • This could link to career or spiritual breakthrough points for the father. Summary Table: Verse 41 Verse Planetary Position Result 41 Sun + Mercury in 9th (Scorpio), Saturn aspects 5th from 8th Four male siblings in the father's line; Father aligned with the Government; Interested in Kaya Siddhis practices

TamilVerse: ஒன்பதாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் சுக சப்தமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி ரோக ஸ்தானமேறிய தன பாக்கியாதிபதியால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் பதினொன்றில் பிதுர் மரணம். ஜாதகனுக்கு ஆறாதிபன் திசையில் விசேஷ யோக பலனுண்டென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: • Lagna: Pisces • Pitrukaraka Sun is in the 9th house (Scorpio) • Conjoined with Mercury, lord of the 4th (Sukha) and 7th (Kalathra) houses • Mars, the 2nd and 9th lord, is in the 6th house, aspecting the Sun and Mercury • Result: o The father dies when the native is 11 years old o The native enjoys special yogas or favourable effects during the dasa of the 6th lord (Sun) Traditional Parashara-Based Analysis Key Placements • Sun in 9th (Scorpio): Sun here, representing the father and ancestral lineage, brings intense karmic experiences through transformation, mainly when influenced by Mars. • Mercury in 9th: Indicates mental processing of dharma, lineage, and father’s intellect. With Sun, forms Budha-Aditya Yoga — usually favourable, but here in a watery fixed sign, outcomes are emotional and intense. • Mars in 6th (Leo): Strong placement — enemy house, obstacles, and karmic triggers. Mars is the karaka for death, and being lord of the 2nd (Maraka) and 9th (Father), it becomes a direct agent of the father’s departure. Nadi Astrology Insight Nadi astrology focuses on house-based effects, especially: • Sun + Mercury in 9th = karmic alignment with father’s destiny • Mars (as 9th lord) in 6th = shows conflict, karma, and medical/fate-driven separation from father • Mars' aspect to the 9th house (its own house) amplifies the karmic weight Father’s Death at Age 11 • Sun’s BCP progression from Lagna (Pisces) would place it in the 11th house (Capricorn) by the 11th year. • This puts Sun in Saturn’s sign and in the 3rd from 9th — a house of separation and sibling karma. • Mars, as a maraka from 6th, aspecting Sun at birth also contributes. • Hence, the death of the father around age 11 fits both Nadi progression and standard dasha-based timelines. Dasa Timing: 6th Lord's Special Effects The verse notes: “ஜாதகனுக்கு ஆறாதிபன் திசையில் விசேஷ யோக பலனுண்டென்பர்.” "During the dasa of the 6th lord, special yogas will manifest for the native." • 6th Lord = Sun, who is also Pitrukaraka • Despite bringing father’s departure, Sun’s dasa also bestows: o Rajayoga-like effects through Budha-Aditya yoga in the 9th o Potential rise in knowledge, dharma, and career o Transformational events, likely positive through purging of karmic baggage Psychological / Karmic Angle • Native likely has early loss of father (age 11), triggering a spiritual/disciplinary growth spurt. • With Mercury (intellect) and Sun (authority) in the 9th, and Mars aspecting, the native may be mentally sharp, independent early in life, and involved in studies or administrative roles with discipline. • The loss fuels inner strength and creates a marked karmic turning point in childhood. Summary Table Verse Planetary Position Result 42 Sun + Mercury in 9th (Scorpio); Mars in 6th (Leo) aspects 9th Father dies at age 11; Native experiences powerful yogas during Sun dasa (6th lord)

TamilVerse: ஒன்பதாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி பாக்கியாதிபதி இரண்டிலிருந்து நோக்கினால் பானு திசையில் பிறந்தால் ஜாதகன் மூன்றாம் நாளரிட்டமாவனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: The Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 9th house (Scorpio) in Pisces Lagna, conjoined with Venus, the lord of the 3rd and 8th houses. This conjunction is aspected by Mars, the 9th and 2nd lord, placed in the 2nd house (Aries). If the native is born during the Sun’s Mahadasha, he will die on the third day of birth. Traditional Astrological Interpretation • Sun + Venus in the 9th house typically suggests matters concerning the father and family legacy. • Venus here rules the 8th house (longevity) and is malefic due to its ownership and conjunction with the Sun, indicating Balarishta (infant death). • Mars is placed in the 2nd house, a Maraka (death-inflicting) house, aspects this conjunction. Being a natural malefic and also the 9th lord, Mars plays a crucial role in both dharma and karma-end patterns. • Dasa effect: If birth occurs during Sun Mahadasha, its placement with the 8th lord and aspect by Maraka Mars indicates a serious Balarishta, leading to death on the third day unless counteracted by strong Arishta-bhanga yogas. Nadi Insight From a Nadi perspective: • The conjunction of Sun and Venus (3rd and 8th lord) in the 9th house signals paternal karmic burden and incomplete past-life father-son karmas. • Mars’ direct aspect from the 2nd house (Maraka sthana) on this conjunction acts as a triggering agent, indicating swift karmic culmination at birth. • This pattern aligns with Nadi indications of early loss or sudden mortality, often emphasised when 8th and 2nd house significators interact with Sun. Timing Insight (BCP & Dasa Based) • The mention of Sun’s Dasa as the cause of death is critical. o Sun Dasa duration (6 years): If it begins at birth and Sun is severely afflicted (as here), the native may not survive infancy. o In this case, death at 3 days is specified — a clear sign of Balarishta due to dasa lord affliction. • BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati): o In the first year, the 1st house (Pisces) is activated. o But the presence of death-triggering patterns overrides protection from Lagna, especially in the absence of benefic aspects or Arishta-bhanga yogas. Summary of the Verse Element Interpretation Father Represented by Sun; conjoined with the 8th lord Venus Cause of Death Mars aspecting Sun+Venus from 2nd (Maraka) house Timing Sun Mahadasha – early infant stage Outcome The native dies on the 3rd day after birth. Final Observations: • This verse is a classic Nadi example of Balarishta, particularly when Sun (life force) is afflicted by Venus (8th lord) and Mars (Maraka). • The absence of benefic influences such as Jupiter's aspect or exalted Moon makes the configuration extremely vulnerable. • If such a chart is seen in real practice, astrologers would advise Arishta-bhanga remedies and verify if the child’s longevity can be protected through medical and spiritual intervention.

TamilVerse: ஒன்பதாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய சுக சப்தம அஷ்டமாதிபதிகளுடன் கூடி உச்ச பஞ்சமாதிபதியால் நோக்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை பூமி மூலம் ஜீவனம் செய்வனென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: For a native with Pisces Lagna, the Sun (Pitrukaraka) is placed in the 9th house (Scorpio) along with Mercury (lord of 4th and 7th) and Venus (lord of 3rd and 8th). This conjunction is aspected by the exalted Moon (5th lord) from Taurus. The father will likely earn his livelihood through land-related means, such as agriculture or real estate. Traditional Astrological Interpretation • Sun, Mercury, Venus in the 9th house: o Indicates a karmic lineage with emphasis on land (4th lord), longevity (8th), communication/skills (3rd). o Pitrukaraka Sun conjoined with house lords connected to land, house, effort, and inheritance, strongly points to a father involved in land-based livelihood, particularly agriculture or property dealings. • Moon exalted in Taurus (3rd house): o Being the 5th lord, Moon’s exalted aspect lends prosperity and sattvic direction to the father’s efforts. o Its 7th aspect on the 9th house stabilises and nurtures the profession through lunar influence—again favouring agriculture (Moon = water, growth). Nadi Principles Insight • The 9th house being heavily populated shows past-life karmas and paternal legacy playing a significant role. • Venus as the 8th lord indicates ancestral inheritance or karmic debt through land, and its presence with the Sun suggests the father benefits materially through it. • The Moon's exaltation signifies a favourable outcome—likely success in land ventures or agricultural productivity. This pattern aligns closely with Nadi methods, where the father’s livelihood is often deduced from 4th, 9th, and 10th house linkages through karakas and house lords. Timing Insight (BCP / Progression) • This verse does not specify a death or critical timing but focuses solely on the father's occupation. • Using BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati): o 9th house activation occurs at age 9. o If a native experiences significant familial or property influences around this age, it confirms the activation of the father’s karma and livelihood domain. Summary Table Element Interpretation Key Houses 9th (Father, Dharma), 4th (Land), 8th (Inheritance), 5th (Fruit) Livelihood Father earns via land/agriculture (Mercury + Venus + Moon) Supportive Aspect Exalted Moon (5th lord) aspecting 9th enhances prosperity Nadi Note Strong karma through land and inheritance from ancestral lineage Final Observations • This verse beautifully illustrates a stable and fruitful paternal karmic pattern. • The conjunction of karaka (Sun) with the 4th and 8th lords, and aspect from the exalted 5th lord, aligns with a productive agricultural/land occupation. • No mention of early death or negative karma in this verse, suggesting positive familial continuation.

TamilVerse: ஒன்பதாமிடத்தில் பிதுர்க்காரகன் திருதிய அஷ்டமாதிபதியுடன் கூடி உச்ச சந்திரனால் பார்க்கப் பட்டிருந்தால் தந்தை ஏகன். அம்மான் வீட்டை யடுத்திருப்பன், அல்ப்ப ஜீவனமென்பர்.
EnglishTranslation: In Pisces Lagna, the Pitrukaraka Sun is placed in the 9th house along with Venus, who is the 3rd and 8th lord. This conjunction is aspected by the exalted Moon. The father will be a lone person, residing near his maternal relatives (his maternal uncle’s house), and will have a life of modest means. Traditional Astrological Interpretation • Sun + Venus in the 9th house: o Sun (karaka for father) conjoined with Venus (3rd & 8th lord) in the 9th house indicates a karmic burden from father’s family lineage. o Venus, as the 8th lord, brings in themes of inheritance, struggle, hidden suffering, and sometimes estrangement or detachment from the paternal side. o As the 3rd lord, Venus can represent displacement or dependency on siblings or in-laws. • Moon exalted in 3rd house (Taurus) aspects the 9th: o Although Moon’s exalted aspect typically provides nurturing and strength, here its position in the 3rd house (relating to maternal relatives) symbolises that emotional or material support comes from maternal sources, not the paternal side. o Moon is also a karaka for mother—its exaltation strengthens the maternal family’s influence in the native’s or father’s life. • Alpajeevana (modest life) is indicated due to: o Venus (8th lord) conjoined with Sun – possibly limiting longevity and prosperity of the father. o Lack of strong wealth/livelihood yogas or trinal influences from Jupiter or other benefics. o Suggests a humble or meagre lifestyle without financial or karmic grandeur. Nadi Perspective Insight • Nadi astrology gives weight to conjunctions and directional aspects: o Venus with Sun in Scorpio is a combust 8th lord, representing karmic burn-through or renunciation. o Father becomes detached or isolated (Sun alone + Venus = emotional alienation). o Maternal influence is pronounced (exalted Moon from 3rd) → indicates father likely lived near or depended on the mother’s family. • This configuration implies that the father may have been physically distant from his own lineage or siblings and more emotionally supported by maternal in-laws. Timing and Progression (BCP or Planetary Years) • No specific age of death or karma activation is mentioned. • However, the 9th house activates at age 9 in BCP (Bhrigu Chakra Paddhati). Significant events regarding the father’s lifestyle or residence may occur around this period. • Venus's role as the 8th lord may bring transformation or loss during its dasa or antardasa, which could coincide with periods of hardship or relocation. Summary Table Element Interpretation Lagna Pisces Sun's Placement 9th house (Scorpio) with Venus (3rd & 8th lord) Aspect Exalted Moon (3rd house – Taurus) Father’s Fate Lives alone, relies on maternal side, lives modestly Nadi Insight Sun + Venus = karmic isolation; exalted Moon = maternal refuge No siblings/wealth Suggests a lack of paternal support and minimal prosperity Final Notes • The verse paints a picture of a solitary and materially restrained father, disconnected from paternal wealth or support, but with emotional or physical proximity to maternal influences. • Strong Venus-Sun combustion signifies karmic challenges through relationships, especially those of the 8th and 9th domains (inheritance and dharma).
